Reviews.Title: “excelent service and Installations”
Reviews.Author: gsepulve
Reviews.Content: A couple of years ago I stayed here for a 2 nighter with a buddy of mine... the room was excellent. in excellent condition. The staff at the front desk was great as well as the bellman. I asked for a little more toiletries to take home for my Mom, and they sent me a huge bag with every amenity they have!! An excellent choice and is 1 block from the Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business, Good for Families”
Reviews.Author: OilIsle
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location in the CBD, a block from Canal and close to the main business areas nearby. Rooms are neat, clean, and modern. For a business traveler, this would be a great hotel, with a Starbucks counter and nice restaurant (MiLa) in the lobby as well as a great view of the city from the Concierge Lounge. For a family vacation, though, there were a few things lacking. Not enough chairs/furniture in the room meant we were always sitting on the bed because there was nowhere else. The pool was also pretty underwhelming, especially since our room had a view of the nice rooftop pool at the Roosevelt across the street. As a business hotel, I would say this would be an excellent choice; for a family vacation, it was still an enjoyable stay, but there are better options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action, but far enough away for some quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia T
Reviews.Content: This was an ideal location. Short 2 blocks to the Quarter with enough of a buffer to be quiet at night. Wonderfully renovated hotel with a gorgeous lobby and a great lobby bar. King size bed room was very large and comfy. We were on club level and there were nice amenities involved Ian, Kendall and Marissa made the stay even better for us with their fantastic hospitality and personal attention. You have to have Ian make you a French 75. Best cocktail in the city! Wouldn't stay anywhere else in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Sharmel C
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited New Orleans for the first time this past week. For the price the hotel was wonderful (a lot better than other hotels I have stayed in). The staff was friendly and helpful. For us the hotel was in a great location; close enough to walk to Canal and Bourbon Streets, but away from all the commotion that comes along with the French Quarter. The only complaint that we had during our experience was that the pool on the 3rd floor was supposed to be heated, but ended up being ice cold when we used it. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit the French Quarter, but wants a quiet hotel to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great This Time Around”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelMiami
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a week before Hurricane Katrina, and I gave it rave reviews. I wish I could have done the same this time... I remember the crisp cold rooms and the fresh feeling the hotel had the first time we stayed there, so much so that I encouraged our friends to please choose this hotel over the JW Marriott. I was so embarrased when the room temperatures were now humid and barely cool. The carpet on their floor was torn in the hallways and cut in ours. Our curtains had a hole. The hallways were downright warm. The rooms smelled musty. The employee at the front desk when we registered was not very warm and welcoming she may have been having a bad day. I wish we would have had the wonderful experience we had before. The location is convenient because it is very close to Bourbon Street, however there are many other hotels nearby that I will look into next time...

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: Campinggrl18
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a dissapointment to me. It seemed run down, with rips in the carpeting, smudged mirrors, and dilapidated furniture. It was also misleading that their advertisement said Wifi, but we come to find out it is only in the lobby. The hotel clerk working behind the desk was rude and unfriendly and would not offer any comparable to our price dispute. We found the cooling system in the room, to not function efficiently and the room was much hotter than the requested 65 degrees. The pool was small and the workout room the same. The only positives from our brief stay were the kind nighttime navigator and the employee working the starbucks counter. We will not be back and wouldn't recommend this hotel with other options in the Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: jpinmiami
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights for a long weekend. After years of staying at jw ritz and lowes, this just doesnt compare. Hotel is older. Ripped carpets in halls, small pool and an exercise room that is size of some closets. Not worthy of "renaissance"brand. I wont stay here again with all other options in same price range. Soft mushy beds and poor water pressure

Reviews.Title: “its all about what you need”
Reviews.Author: mfrou
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently visited New Orleans for the first time in August 2012 for Satchmofest. We stayed at Renaissance Pierre Marquette hotel which was located on Common st., a street away from the famous Canal St. many said the location is great, and it really is. Don't expect them to be extremely quick on the room service front, but its a decent clean hotel and did it for what we needed it for. However I was disappointed that they claimed to have complimentary internet in their advertisement, but this means only in the lobby and not in the rooms. You need to pay for wireless, as well as local calls (1.09$) which was a shock when we were about to check out. But all in all it is a good hotel and very nice staff!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Gem”
Reviews.Author: JhayR
Reviews.Content: From the outside, Renaissance Pere Marquette Hotel appeared very non-descript and unappealing. However, once you entered through their doors you were transported into a fashionably chic, brilliantly designed and charmingly colorful haven. Not only was I dazzled by the interior design, but was equally pleased with the phenomenal customer service provided by the bell hop, housekeeping and front desk staff, especially supervisor Ms Yvette. My room was nicely equipped with all the latest amenities such as a computer jack, coffee maker, digital safe with laptop capacity, 40" flat screen TV, mini refrigerator, clock radio/CD player, telephone, iron and ironing board. The bathroom was a picture of elegance, flair and style with its contemporary fixtures and hallmark high quality towels. I was also impressed with the exercise room and pool which were both quite modern and cozy, but adequate. Best of all, was the hotel's location being right around the corner from Carondelet Street which becomes Bourbon Street after crossing Canal. On Carondelet Street there are several restaurants such as the famed Hobnobber's, Daisy Dukes and Streetcar Cafe to name a few; which is precisely why the Renaissance Pere Marquette is an absolute gem.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favourite hotels in one of my favourite cities”
Reviews.Author: cupcakena
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect very close to Bourbon Street without the craziness. The room was huge and the bathroom spacious and very clean. The lobby looked like it had recently been updated and there were lots of comfy chairs to check your emails. The most impressive feature however was the staff â€“ they were always very friendly, courteous and helpful even under some trying conditions â€“ ie during our stay there was a large group of very noisy, very messy and at times very rude young people. The Gym was good and had plenty of equipment. The only complaint I have would be that the coffee shop closed too early. If it closed at 4pm instead of 1pm it would have suited me perfectly. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Lees33
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with a great location but I would not say it was a 4 star hotel. It just lacks the small things that make a 4 star. There was no offer to help us with our bags when we checked in. The valet parking took forever. Housekeeping put the bare minumum of linens in the bathroom but would bring extra if asked. With all the other great 4 star hotels in New Orleans, they just need to step it up a little.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: HopeInUSA
Reviews.Content: We were also in town with the 35,000 Lutheran kids so that made everything a little hard to get to but the kids were super polite, just LOTS of them! The hotel was in a great location as are most of the other Marriott properties in the area. We booked last minute (4 hrs. Before arriving) and we were given a handicapped room that was very spacious. I was recognized as Elite at the front desk. Valet parking was fast and painless but no one asked at the front desk if we parked a car so when it delayed us a bit when trying to retrieve our car because we hadn't been charged for it. The bed was comfy but the pillows were horrible. I requested extra pillows on my booking and they were not in the room but hey, it was only booked a few hours earlier! Also, we had trouble getting washcloths left in the room both days although they brought them when requested. The staff was adequate, we didn't eat in the restaurant but did get a coffee at Starbucks. You can't beat the location of the hotel and it's very quiet. Lots of foot traffic on the streets so we always felt safe. I would have given it 3 stars but the location was just too good!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action but away from the noise.”
Reviews.Author: Vitidemi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a few blocks away from Bourbon Street but on the other side of Canal so you're close to the partying but can go back to peace and quiet. Everything is within a short walk such as Jackson Square, the river, casino, and great restaurants and bars. The rooms are nice but a little small. Forget the pool. They have one but it is more like a small kiddie dipping pool. Gym is also small with no weight equipment other than some dumbells. Parking is valet only and $29 per day. You probably don't need a car if you're just visiting downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice setting, so close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: MissHRSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 3 day weekend. Right in the middle of everything, great food & shops near by. Very friendly staff & nice rooms. Spacious, clean, nice furniture & setting. Ask for a high room with a view other than that you just see street! I would stay here again, nice room for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “A True STAR in the Crescent City”
Reviews.Author: dustinokc
Reviews.Content: Was just in town during Essence and it was a great stay...we were not in town for Essence but found that the hotel was in the perfect location and away from Canal which was nice. Rooms were very clean and quiet(considering being downtown), great places to eat very nearby. If you stay here you will have ZERO complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pick6king
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel two split nights before and after a cruise out of the New Orleans port. We were just looking for a reasonably priced option within decent walking access to some of the touristy areas. This hotel was aces in that regard. The price was very reasonable, and the accommodations quite adequate. However, the real upshot is the location. Itâ€™s just over 1 block from the corner of Canal and Bourbon Streets. That makes it convenient to the French Quarter action, but removed enough to be very quiet. There are several restaurants within a few blocks, and there are Walgreens and CVS stores within 2 blocks for convenience items. I didn't notice this the first night, but for our second stay, the bed was rock hard and terribly uncomfortable. Combined with the 5am false fire alarm (stuff happens, no big deal), it made for a very poor night of rest. While I'm complaining, I'll mention the annoying elevators. The "door held open too long" beep literally starts after about 1 second. Also, on at least one occasion, the doors would not heed the "door open" button and nearly closed on a child. The cab ride to and from the cruise terminal is comfortably brief, but slightly pricey ($7 per person for 4 people) for such a short ride. While not an overwhelmingly special hotel, the combination of price and location earn it high overall marks. I was torn between 3 and 4 stars due to the second poor night (especially the bed). I would award 3.5 if I could. Since my top 2 goals were achieved (price and location), I settled on 4.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: matt f
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay here. Rooms were larger than we expected and well kept. However the best part of this hotel was its location. Street car stops and Bourbon street were all only 2 blocks away. The staff was always accommodating and made some great recommendations. Only down side was our room was lacking a couch or other place to sit, but we spent so little time in our room that it didn't matter much.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, chic, hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: lostdecoy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed here for an extended weekend this past week and had a wonderful stay. It was part of a vacation package for a VERY reasonable price and was so glad this hotel was part of my trip. Location is FANTASTIC - walking distance to all and access to both the St. Charles & Canal street cars just around the block. Great eateries within a few blocks on the same side of Canal street too! If you want a cheap earlybird breakfast, head to Daisy Dukes around the corner. Since this is not actually -in- the French Quarter, very quiet and easy to get a good nights sleep without disturbances. We had a king corner room with spacious windows. Rooms were clean, furniture seemed very new without distress. Beds were also super comfy. Rooms are small but I have no need to be able to do a cartwheel in my room :) Bathroom size makes up for it as the bathrooms are HUGEEEE! I hate staying in hotels where the bathroom door is in your lap when using the toilet...this was far from the scenerio. No comments on house keeping though noted they were always on our floor every morning servicing rooms. We prefer not to have our items disturbed while away and keep the Do Not Disturb sign at all times - which was followed by staff. All encounters with staff were a pleasure, were very friendly and always with a smile. Always greeter by the front desk everytime we left/entered and asked if we needed anything. Also, front desk had different fresh fruit in bowls for guest on side. Free wifi in lobby had good signal...and I might add while sitting in lobby, the air smelled WONDERFUL - it's like they had some sort of aromatherapy scents in the air vents. Bar was set up beautifully and plenty of comfortable seating for lounging throughout the area. DEFINITELY would recommend staying here on a trip to New Orleans if you want to be close to it all without being directly on top of it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenw89
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend in New Orleans at the Renaissance Pere Marquette. The location is very good...easy walking distance to the French Quarter, Jackson Square, Casino, etc.. The lobby is small, but offers plenty of comfy seating in the hallway leading to the bar and Starbucks coffee area. We were mostly pleased with the hotel. My husband is a Marriott rewards member, so we were able to request bedding, room location, etc. ahead of time. We did receive the bedding we requested (King), but did not have the extra towels we requested. We had also requested a high floor and were placed on the 6th floor, which was fine. We were frustrated with the fact that our room was not cleaned the first day. When we returned to the room at 5 pm after a day of sightseeing, our room had not been serviced at all. I contacted the front desk to inquire if the maids were still in the cleaning process, and was told no, and they didn't know why our room hadn't been cleaned since we did not have the do not disturb sign out. I was told the best they could do was send someone to exchange our towels. This was not a good start to our mini vacation, but for the rest of our stay the rom was properly cleaned each day. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant, but did have drinks at the bar on 2 evenings. The atmosphere was great and the drinks were excellent. The room itself was small, but did have a nice view of the courtyard pool.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: 202BrianT
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Pere Marquette is in a great location, just a block off of Canal street, and easy walking distance to the French Quarter, Charles Street trolley, and the waterfront. We stayed just one night on our first wedding anniversary. We let them know this at check in, and they arranged for a complimentary bottle of wine to be sent to our room. Very modern rooms. Small outdoor pool on the 3rd floor that was great for a break from the June heat. Lobby bar was nice for a cocktail before heading out to dinner. Starbucks coffee bar with bagels and muffins for quick breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “just average for above average price”
Reviews.Author: kwhkop
Reviews.Content: rooms small and no dresser for clothes, few hangers in closet, marble floors in bath are a hazard when water is added. almost fell several times due to short shower curtain allowed more water on floor. staff friendly but either their computer system or all of them just couldnt get things correct the entire week. location not terrible if not raining, which it was alot of the time making it hard to go for food, other than over the top priced room service. walking to ruby slipper was 3 blocks good place to eat ( only place close) but arriving soaked was unpleasant and milos the attached rest. to hotel didnt have breakfast and very expensive. clean and trendy look to hotel but thats it. pool small and at deepest 3 foot deep. and seating around pool was for about 10 max.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: K T
Reviews.Content: The weekend of Memoriral Day my cousin and I stayed at the Pere Marquette. We arrived early and our room wasn't ready due to a full night prior so, we took opportunity to eat lunch. (after Michael so graciously secured our bags for us) Having no clue of a close, good place to dine we asked Yvette. The recommendation was "Deanie's" and it was AWESOME! Having visited NOLA before I really don't understand how we missed the spot. While eating lunch we got a call our room was ready. We returned to a nice double queen room and our bags were brought up to us by staff- who was most helpful with radio choices. The hotel was clean, convienent and the staff was delightful and most helpful. Tired of Po'boy sandwiches and fast food cousin and I decided to have dinner at the hotel restaurant "MiLa". There are no words for the food!!!!!! The Crispy Baby French Chicken was the BEST dish EVER. According to Cousin the Halibut was great. The bartender Kylie was great as was the bar/restaurant manager (Kendall, I believe). After returning from a night out we barely made last call at "Bar UnCommon" (separate from MiLa) and the bartenders (Tomas and Eli) obliged to send me off to my room with a nightcap! The next day after shopping and sightseeing we again dined in the hotel this time at Bar UnCommon (rice and gumbo was delicious) and Tomas' creative drinks were TASTY! Cab service was sporadic but timely, (it is on a side street- hence no noise at night!) we actually lucked up and had the same cabbie to the mall Sunday and airport in Monday! I said ALL that to say I was thoroughly pleased and our stay was absolutely wonderful and every time I go to NOLA I will stay there again and would recommend it to anyone who wants a close enough to stay to the Bourbon Street, the casino, malls, and superdome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a short trip!”
Reviews.Author: LiliKB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 2nd wedding anniversary with a 2 night stay in New Orleans. I had been there many times, and wanted to share my favorite places with him. The proximity to the French Quarter is great, just 2 blocks away! The St. Charles Street car almost passes by the hotel to take you out to the Garden District. The bed was super comfortable. The area was quiet, and so was the hotel. It was not as luxurious as other Renaissance hotels I've stayed at, and the staff seemed a bit disinterested. My only gripe is the the hotel pool was closed for renovation the only 2 nights we were there, and there was no bathtub in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and worth the price”
Reviews.Author: redfred
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I had a conference near the Superdome and my wife wanted to explore the quarter while I was in the meeting. So less than a mile walk for me and a few blocks for her. It also has a pool (although rained everyday...) This is an OK hotel, the room was a little small and the ambience not very upscale. But - the location was great, and the 3 night stay was only about $560 (including taxes, etc.) I think, all in all, it was a great deal for the money. Because it is small, there is far less activity going on and it has a quiet feel. The concierge was pleasant and helpful and the Internet in the lobby was free and accessible. Downside: On Sunday, the room was not cleaned until 6 PM. No wireless internet (although this the hotel is actually in the process of fixing this at the current time. A technician has been working for 2 weeks and some rooms are live. Getting cabs can be iffy. Only 4 drawers in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel with an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: roxycape
Reviews.Content: Really happy to see NOLA on the rise again. This hotel is just off Canal St and within walking distance of many attractions. Definitely bewly renovated with a sleek, retromodern aesthetic. Lobby bar is really chic looking. The rooms are a little on the small side but they feel very cool and European so I wasn't particularly bothered. Despite its close location to everything, it's a pretty quiet hotel. The rooftop pool is a nice little oasis, too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Kgplough
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Renaissance Pere Marquette Hotel on a long getaway weekend and it was perfect for our itinerary. We started our weekend on a Thursday and were politely greeted on arrival. The staff is very friendly and helpful and told us about some live music later in the evening that night. Our room was clean and neat with a nice view of downtown and the pool a few levels below. Daily service was prompt and left any of our personal items undisturbed. We love the extra special service of opening the door or hailing a cab which is expected in a city and done with a smile here. Take advantage of the knowledge of the front desk to suggest great restaurants and places to see from the French Quarter to the Riverwalk to the Garden District. We will definitely be back and thank you for a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsBrewster
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to everything you could possibly want to see & do. Room 718 was a nice size as well as the bathroom. This room overlooked the roof top pool. The decor in the lobby was beautiful. Valet was $32.48/day. Breakfast for 2 was $44 and room service for 1 (new orleans burger) was $22. If you are unable to get into a restaurant or don't want to be out late at night try Oceana Grill, they will deliver here! I will definitely stay here the next time I visit New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DaphnesMommy
Reviews.Content: Room was very nice updated look, huge bathroom! Had breakfast at Mila's a bit too pricey for eggs but when your on vacation. . .

Reviews.Title: “Return visitor who really likes this hote.”
Reviews.Author: devers0122
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Pere Marquette is the location. It is one block out of the French Quarter across Canal Street from Bourbon Street. So its close to everything, but also very quiet. We never heard anyone else in either of our two stays there. The rooms are medium to small, but they are nice and clean. We stayed in an upgraded room on our second stay there and had a nice flat screen tv in the room. The other room we had the first time had an older tv (but who goes to New Orleans to watch tv)? I recommend this hotel for business travel or a couples trip. With the size of the room (and what's going on in New Orleans) I don't think I would be good for children.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Geneva M
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel - great service and in a fantastic location. This hotel is very close to the French Quarter, among various shopping stores/mall. I stayed on the 19th FL - would recommend this to everyone as it offers a 'special lounge' that's always stocked with treats, drinks, etc. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly people”
Reviews.Author: ragm86
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay was wonderful. The room was not large, but we didn't spend much time there. The pool area was adequate, and was the fittness room. We had breakfast at Mila's and it was very good. The clerks, doormen, and other employees were so friendly and helpful. Remember, this is a very old building that has been renovated many times. We found it to be very enjoyable. Within walking distance to the French Quarter and streetcar stops.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sueandtom776
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one block off Canal Street, a great location to get to the French Quarter. The staff is excellent. Room 1908 was on a corner with four windows. Great bed as with all Marriotts.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, small price”
Reviews.Author: Rena B
Reviews.Content: I knew that the room would be small when I booked this hotel, but having been to New Orleans many times I also knew that we would be spending little time in the room. We were pleasantly surprised that though the room is quite petite it somehow managed not to be cramped. The location was perfect, walking distance to the Quarter, the Warehouse District, and the Marigny. The pool itself is shaded much of the time, which is good in a New Orleans summer as it keeps the water pleasantly cool. But there was still sun to soak in if one so desired. They charge for wireless internet, but have free computers in the lobby. The public spaces were stylishly designed. The only problem with the room was the curtains. There were sheer curtains over the windows, something we didn't even notice until we were awakened by the sun streaming in early the next morning. Fortunately, my husband and myself travel with sleep masks. However, blackout curtains are a basic in most hotel rooms and are especially necessary in a late night town like New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Itsy-bitsy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: DebraKriz
Reviews.Content: First I must say that I truly enjoy the Renaissance Hotel chain. I love the intimate vibe of the Renaissance with it being an upscale chain of boutique hotels: big city amenities with a small town vibe. I knew what we were getting when I booked a "small room" at the Pere Marquette in New Orleans but I figured since we would be at JazzFest all day a small room would be fine. In actuality it was fine even though the room was probably 11 x 15. We couldn't open two doors at the same time, ie, if the closet door was open we couldn't open the bathroom door. But, being nit-picky, I do have some minor complaints: 1. There was bad Internet and TV service in the hotel rooms. As a matter of policy I do not believe it's appropriate to charge $19 per day for Internet service but it's even more outrageous when the Internet doesn't work! There was a basketball playoff game one evening but the TV cable wasn't working so we only saw some colorful images on the TV. 2. Trash can? Is there any reason a hotel can't afford to put TWO trash cans in the room--one for the bathroom and one in the room? 3. Towels! I'm a staunch conservationist but when I'm paying $290 per night for a hotel room I do want plenty of clean towels. I had to request additional towels every single day I was at this hotel. Sorry but 2 bath towels, one hand towel, and one face cloth do not cut it in New Orleans. We are morning shower people and after a full day in the heat and dust at JazzFest I really need a shower before dinner. That's 4 towels a day which was dang near impossible to get. And that's it. Room service was good, quick, and fairly reasonably priced. The front desk receptionist was a font of knowledge. Everyone was friendly and helpful, location couldn't be better, the bed was great, shower was perfect..... But there's always those "little things".....

Reviews.Title: “Cool lobby with several places to relax with a drink.”
Reviews.Author: travelingcircus38
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and updated. Gym is small but adequate and uncrowded. Mila restaurant (in lobby) has excellent food. I had a salad and seared tuna. Valet is pricey...even for Nola.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lyndae
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights in April. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a little off the beaten path, but only one block off Canal and Bourbon. If you want to be away from all the craziness, this is a good choice. The hotel is clean and the rooms are pleasant. We stayed in a corner room and this added some view and size. It is several blocks from the casino/water, but certainly walkable. The pool is small and quiet, if you are looking for pool party, this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, 5 minutes walk to Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: OliverHardy
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel, with the usual Marriott amenities (a very small pool though). Professional staff. Very Close to the French Quarter. Club food very average. Room air conditioner a little noisy. But overall recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected excellence”
Reviews.Author: RMZR1
Reviews.Content: The whole town was booked up this past weekend. My wife and I decided to get away for the weekend. I was skeptical because the Pere Marquette had a vacancy and no one else did. My fears were unfounded. We were later than expected arriving. The front desk whisked us in. Our room was very attractive. The view from the 15th floor was good. Shower with good pressure. Pretty bathroom. Great lobby and lobby bar. Staff very attentive. Our Saturday breakfast order placed Friday night was misplaced. The food and beverage manager brought it up himself and put it on the house. Convenient location. Valet parking was quick both checking in and checking out. The Pere Marquette is now on my list to call first.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: NorthernNJTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a pretty good location. A short walk to Bourbon St and Canal as well. It is a long walk down to the water, convention center and the casino so if that is where you are headed, book closer. The hotel and restaurant were good but nothing spectacular. All in all I was happy with this choice.

Reviews.Title: “60th birthday celebration - New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: MelDan64
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for my 60th bday celebration. The room was nice, clean and was not too small. I had read other reviews and asked for a corner room because other reviews stated they were bigger. Stay in room 501 overlooking the pool with windows on two sides. while not in the French Qtr, it is in walking distance, about 5-10 minutes and we are not fast walkers. close to a tolley car stop if you want to go to the Garden District by public trpt. Staff was phenominal!!! Especially Angelique and Tareneisha. would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Carlos82
Reviews.Content: Walk to Bourbon Street, Superdome. Enjoyed the hotel, the receptionist was great. She had a good sense of humor. The Club Lounge was a little small, but wasn't too crowded. The room was great, enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Andermeer
Reviews.Content: This hotel proved to be a perfect location. We easily walked to the French Quarter and had close access to the St. Charles streetcar for trips out to the Garden District. Our room was jusrt right, clean and quiet. Breakfast each morning was delightful and the service throughout our stay was courteous, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy138
Reviews.Content: I came to city on business and I stayed at this gem. The hotel is classy and elegant. Food service was tasty and inexpensive. Visit restaurant Domenica around the corner during happy hour for 1/2 price pizza and Abita beer.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Bourbon but not too close”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect in that you could walk to anywhere in the French Quarter, but there was no concern of noise from Canal or Bourbon at night. Very clean, updated for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Gmurphyjcap
Reviews.Content: The Pere Marquette is a stylish hotel in the Central Business District, close to the French Quarter but so much quieter. I was able to score a very favorable rate for this hotel via Priceline and felt very smug about the elegance, convenience and comfort of this hotel for less than I've paid to stay in EconoLodges off the interstate. The room, while moderately sized, had everything we needed (flat screen TV, beautiful bath, comfortable beds). Took a refreshing dip in the small outdoor pool. Enjoyed a Sazerac at the bar one night before dinner. Within a block were convenience stores, two streetcar lines, and several nice restaurants. A block further and you're in the French Quarter. I'm a pretty low-maintenance traveler, so my interactions with hotel staff were limited but pleasant. New Orleans has so many choices for hotels; I've been five times and tried somewhere new on each visit. The Pere Marquette is one definitely one I'd go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: chipeddler
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night before moving to to the Omni Royal, where we usually stay. We booked the room on priceline for cheap. The hotel lobby and bar were beautiful and comfy. The staff at front desk, bar and restaurant were all exceptional. The room was nice and the bed comfortable. I am always surprised when people complain about small rooms in an old hotel, thats the way they were built, and should be expected. Best part of hotel is location. Off Canal street, so close to business, streetcar and necessities, but barely 2 blocks to Bourbon St action. Very nice place and we may consider staying here for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and stylish”
Reviews.Author: chas218
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very upscale. The valets were very nice. The lobby is very stylish and elegant. The room was a bit small, but on par for a hotel in the city. It was decorated in a contemporary fashion. We asked for a corner room, which had windows on 2 walls, and a great view, even though it was of the street and other buildings, I still loved it. :) Amenities include a flat-screen TV, a mini-fridge and a safe. That's it. The bathroom was decorated nicely, and a pretty good size, and the water pressure was average. The location is great for tourists. It's a block off of Canal Street, and about 2 blocks from Bourbon Street. Easy walking distance to the French Quarter. Now for the negatives. Parking is $29+tax per day, and you have to tip the valets. Keep that in mind if you get a good deal like we did (Thanks, Priceline!). The employees (excluding the valets) seemed disinterested and bored. My son fell in the lobby and cut his face pretty bad. Only one employee came up and asked how he was, even though a child was screaming and bleeding. There was no offer to call 911 or give us directions to an urgent care place. We, frantic parents, did it ourselves, as the employees stared at the sky. We didn't swim, but got a look at the pool, it seemed kinda tiny. That being said, the hotel is in the middle of the Central Business District, and probably geared toward business travelers, not families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Brenda K
Reviews.Content: I have been a Marriott frequent customer for years and as such expect all of their properties to have the same quality standards in place. My New Orleans trip was a short one and during the Final Four weekend. The Pere Marquette is located just a few blocks from Canal St, Bourbon St., Harrah's casino, and some of the best restuarants in the country. The room was beautiful and in typical Marriott style had luxious comfortable beds. The bar/lounge area was great and the bartender went above and beyond to make us feel at home. The service was excellent. Everyone from the Valet parking staff to the conceierge workers was extremely helpful and courteous. It's a beautiful property with a lot of local history. Ask them how they got the name, "Pere Marquette" it's a great story.

Reviews.Title: “Going Downhill Fast”
Reviews.Author: acoulter
Reviews.Content: After more than six years experience with this property, I will never book another night. They lost a rental car yesterday. Yes. Lost it by giving the car to another guest. The Concierge Lounge was poorly staffed with the wine locked up. Errors in room arrangements. This is not a typical Marriott property and should be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and place to stay while in NO”
Reviews.Author: dn483
Reviews.Content: Our group traveled to NO for St. Pat's Day, and stayed at the Pere Marquette. The location was excellent- a short walk to Bourbon Street, but quiet. Room was clean, comfortable and a good value. Restaurant downstairs was excellent, and Starbucks in lobby convenient. The staff was helpful and friendly. Absolutely no complaints. Bath was white marble and nice size. The pool was quite small, but that wasn't an issue for us. We were on 10th floor while our friends were on 8 and 5.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: LetsGoNowOK
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff. Close to the action, Bourbon Street, French Quarter. I was there on business and I found it very convenient to walk to all the places I needed to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, But Not 4*”
Reviews.Author: yogimax
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on Priceline for about $65 a night, a truly great deal and value for downtown New Orleans. The best feature of the hotel is its location, about a block from Bourbon Street and the French Quarter. The exterior of the hotel is unimpressive and signage is poor. The lobby is somewhat small and dark, but the staff quite helpful. Checkin was easy. We were assigned one of the smaller rooms, probably a function of booking on Priceline. Despite the size, the room was clean and functional, with the exception of the safe which did not work. My only real criticism is that this is certainly not a four star property as Priceline would have you believe. All in all though, it is a great value for the money and serves well the budget minded visitor to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay....Pool very small”
Reviews.Author: LLAHAVE
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights, no complaints, can't say it was spectacular. We did not have a car, we took the E2 express bus from the airport for $1.30 each. Bus leaves you off about 4 blocks from the hotel, easy safe walk. ( bus does not run to downtown on Sundays) No problems with this hotel. It is convient, room was clean, service and staff very good. We have stayed in New Orleans before and felt there are less expesive rooms in the area. For example the Marriott Courtyard 2 blocks east. We have stayed in the French Quarter in some old, not so inviting hotels that charge the same. When in Orleans we do not use hotel sevices much. We did not use the bar or resturant in the hotel, they looked nice but can not comment. They do have room service , also not used. There is a coffee counter that serves Starbucks in the lobby( it is almost a Starbucks, but not an offical one). There is a creape(sp) coffee shop accross the street that serves more of a breakfast that was very good. It is sort of self service. Our room was a corner room, I am guessing part of a suite, we had a murphy king bed , which seemed odd, however the room was good size and comforable. .( I peaked into another room and it looked smaller.) There is a safe in the room, which we like. This hotel is part of the Marriott chain. The pool is not inviting and very small, it is wedged in amoung high rises. So , if you are thinking "resort hotel" to lounge around the pool, I would not . This is a very nice safe city high rise hotel. It is located on the north side of Canel St. on Common St.,easy one block walk to Burbon St, St Charles Trolley, Canel Trolley. (Tip: buy the $ 3.00 all day pass for the busses and trollies from the machine on Canel and Burbon island.) Try Brennens happy hour , $5. Martinis and $5 food ,5 to 7. Great value. Just off Burbon.

Reviews.Title: “Great CBD hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bivory
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before moving to a B&B, but it was great. The pool is small and so is the fitness center (but at least the fitness center is open 24 hours). MiLa is right downstairs (it is pricey though). Walking is no problem to the French Quarter, Canal Street is right around the corner as well as the street car pickup to the Garden District. The elevators are really quick too! Lobby is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job”
Reviews.Author: dutchguy2
Reviews.Content: Other than the rooms being a little old, there is nothing really wrong about the Pere Marquette, which I guess is damning with faint praise. Most of the staff are nice (there were exceptions during our stay) and the rooms are clean, etc., it's just that nothing about this hotel really pops out as deserving special mention. That being said, it is very central which is a great selling point, especially during Mardi Gras.

Reviews.Title: “I probably wouldn't do it again”
Reviews.Author: TEXKEYSTONE
Reviews.Content: 3 nights beginning 2/28 for a convention. Room service terribly inefficient, no shampoo in the room two days in a row, hard bed, mini pillows, no food choices mid afternoon except room service. Colleagues had similar experiences including a full bed collapse. Ultimately relocated to a different hotel. In fairness, it was the week after Mardi Gras. Maybe they were just recovering or something.

Reviews.Title: “Valet Parking Expensive”
Reviews.Author: TexasDiva01
Reviews.Content: Hotel front desk staff was friendly,rooms were clean with a nice spacious bathroom. Hotel located on side street but very convient for walking to local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Place has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: IrishFan051986
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the French Quarter but a few blocks off on a seedy side street that smelled like vomit. The rooms are starting to show their age. The only bright spot is that each room has its own individual wifi which is nice compared to other hotels where the signal is often weak.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: QueenzTravlr
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel during Mardi Gras. The lobby and our room were both really clean and attractive. The hotel still has some of its original historic characteristics, like the windows. Our room, though small, was welcoming and nicely decorated: the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was spacious with a marble sink, nice lighting, and good water pressure. I travel ALOT and therefore have the Marriott Rewards membership. I was granted access to the Club/ Concierge lounge where they provide complimentary breakfast and dinner on the weekdays. The food was freshly prepared with hot foods and fresh fruit; the dining room is on the top floor, allowing you to look out over New Orleans. The hotel is really well located. It is just one block from Bourbon Street and 2 blocks from St. Charles Ave, allowing you to easily walk to all of the fun things to do and see, but far enough away from the Mardi Gras festivities that you can sleep in peace (when ever you decide sleep becomes necessary in this crazy city). My only gripe would be that the on-site parking lot was pretty expensive- $35/night, and they charged us extra for being parked there during an "event" (a Mardi Gras parade on Canal St), even though we'd had the car parked there for 2 straight days without ever using it once.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Stephie_Pie
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Everyone was very nice and willing to assist with making our New Orleans experience a great one. It's a block away from the French Quarter which was great because most restaurants, bars, and attractions were within walking distance. I think we only took a cab about three times. You won't hear the partying noises from the busy streets which is a plus. Room was a bit small but very clean and modern. Big downer for us was the lack of wifi in the guest rooms. It was only available from the lobby which is not what I'm used to. Pretty much all hotels, (including 2 and 3 star hotels) are wifi equipped. They did offer hard wire access for a daily fee but that doesnt work for ipads or iphones so it didn't work for us. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would go back but only if they update their wifi accessibility.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: jjssi
Reviews.Content: Room was small with cheap furniture from some other era. Bathroom was at least spacious. No wifi. Hard wire only which is NG for iPads/phones. Lobby seemed a limitless weird somehow. Place looked better on line. Attached restaurant is only appropriate for your typical boring hotel breakfast (NOT NOLA style !)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: rabidstoat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a block off the French Quarter, on the road that becomes Bourbon Street on the other side of the canal. Though you will hear typical street noise from the rooms, you won't hear the loud partying that permeates the French Quarter at night. Higher rooms presumably have less noise. I was on the 5th floor by the street and, given that I managed to sleep in until 11 am one morning, I would say the noise was no problem. The rooms are what one would expect for a hotel of this type. My king-sized bed was comfy, and there were adequate electrical outlets for all of my electric doodads. There's a TV, desk, kinda old-looking easy chair, and a coffee maker, mini fridge, and safe in the cabinet under the TV. The room I was in wasn't the biggest room I've ever been in, but hey, by New York standards it was pretty large! Did not feel cramped at all, I'd guess it was 'average sized'. And now a word about the bathroom! I liked that it was spacious (and clean!). There wasn't a tub, but a small shower stall. The neatest thing I thought was that the shower head was on a rail that went up-and-down, so it could be adjusted for height, in addition to pivoting all about. There was also both shampoo AND conditioner provided, which I always appreciate when traveling. So, good solid hotel in a great location. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Leeandob
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property the night before our cruise on Royal Caribbean. The place is very nice, good location, near lots of sites. When we came back we realized how we should have stayed here again as our second choice was not as good. This place is located near the casino too, if that is of interest to anyone reading.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: nova5star
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate and the room was clean and functional. Thermostat panel partially ripped off the wall or screws were stripped but it still worked and wasn't a huge eyesore. All in all a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: senyor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a block or two from the French Quarter... An ideal location away from all the noise and hub-bub of Bourbon Street. Although on rhe small side, rooms are comfortable. The staff here is attentive and nice to deal with. We were treated royally for our 40th anniversary weekend. Watch for special rates (ours was $159 with breakfast... A good deal in Nola).

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, not glitzy”
Reviews.Author: MarkLBoston
Reviews.Content: The Pere Marquette doesn't have a 4 story lobby with waterfalls and a marble exterior sign. But they work pretty hard to achieve a top rating among New Orleans' stiff hotel competition. I almost missed the 40's style sign over the main door, but later saw a more elegant entrance from the parking area. The reception clerks were friendly and efficient. Beyond the front desk there's a retro-decorated, stylish bar that was busy every night, a plush lobby, coffee bar, and the well-reviewed Mila restaurant. Elevators have a "This Car Up" sign that made me think of old-school department stores, but they are fast and I never had to wait more than a few seconds for one to appear. My room was adequately sized with a well equipped bathroom, large closet, comfortable bed, and flat-screen TV with about 35 cable channels (HBO yes, HD reception, no). Thumbs up for the refrigerator and no mini-bar. There's an in-room safe and plenty of lights and electric outlets. Internet is wired only and expensive, but in the lobby it's free wifi that's the fastest hotel internet I've ever seen. The furniture was adequate but nothing special. The window looked out on a colorfully-lit swimming pool. Everything was clean and in good condition. I liked the framed photo of a New Orleans front door featuring my room number. The friendly concierge told me there's one in every room. Nice 4-star touch! Room service was reasonably priced with an interesting menu. The concierge answered my questions about the city quickly and accurately. It's a convenient location but not lively - the downtown financial district is almost ghostly quiet at night, but just a short walk from Canal & Bourbon. Some of the rooms are oddly shaped due to the triangular layout of the hotel building. My room had the TV in an alcove that was not visible from the desk. But the solid building is quiet and I rarely heard any noise at all from inside or outside. In the neighborhood I walked past some truly glitzy hotel palaces, like the nearby rich-relative J.W. Marriott. I don't think the Pere Marquette can quite live up to that standard, but they come pretty close.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: KimmoR
Reviews.Content: As regular Marriott Guest I had my concerns as I rarely stay at Renaissance Hotels. However, I was pleasantly surprised upon arriving to the hotel. It actually started even before I reached the hotel as reviewing the details of my reservation, I discovered that I had been upgraded due to my Marriott Silver status. The staff was very friendly and the location of the hotel in relation to Bourbon Street was brilliant: close by but far enough! For a 272 room hotel, Pere Marquette had surprisingly 6 elevators! The service was pleasant, just what I have grown to expect from a Marriott including all the usual amenities. What really impressed me was neither the hotel nor the room but the bathroom! It's size impressed me. There was plenty of space for to walk around with a with a separate shower cubicle. However, the only thing I was disappointed about was the fact the top floor's carpet needed to have been refurbished some time ago. Overall, should I return to New Orleans, Pere Marquette will be my first choice for accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: SouthernGirlOhio
Reviews.Content: Once we finally got parked......the check in was seamless and staff very nice. Room was nice & clean and spacious for the two of us.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martin R
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pere Marquette before New Year's. Very much enjoyed the location (easy walk to Canal Street), quiet, cleanliness, and extremely helpful and friendly staff in the Club Room. Would be pleased to return again.

Reviews.Title: “A Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Heather H
Reviews.Content: This hotel has become a favorite of mine since my husband and I first stayed there two years ago. The rooms are clean and comfortable and nicely appointed. Also, the staff is friendly and ready to assist you. One of the best reasons to stay here is its great location. No matter what is on your sightseeing itinerary; the Quarter, a St. Charles Trolley ride, or shopping on Magazine Street, it's only a short walk there from the hotel entrance. Valet parking is also easy and very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: RWilliams05
Reviews.Content: The location is truly amazing. One block off Canal Street. The hotel has a modern feel to it including wi fi in the rooms which was a real bonus for me. We came off a cruise and went to the hotel early. They had a room for us at 10:30 am which was fantastic. Unfortunately, it smelled of smoke so we asked for another room. A small charge later, we were upgraded to the club floor with a large room and a great view. We were very happy to be able to check in early. We later used the club lounge and found the staff very helpful and friendly. We appreciated the warm chocolate chip cookies! Having said that, the room was not very special. The windows are single glazed and with two football games on during the weekend, the late night noise from the street carried clearly even up the the 18th floor. The hotel is expensive, probably overly so for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: pangochic
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over New Year's 2011 and we absolutely loved it! The location was convenient to all the amenities we needed including: pharmacy (CVS/Walgreens, Breakfast, Convenient store, etc). It is only a block away from Bourbon street after you cross Canal St. so walking was a breeze. The staff was pleasant, although as mentioned by some of the reports here--they have an unusually limited check-in lobby. I also enjoyed their fitness center which met our basic needs during our stay. Because we did not drive into town, I cannot speak to the Parking experience. Overall, I highly recommend this location if you are looking for a modern, tranquil location off the busy streets yet convenient location for the surrounding amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Setter2
Reviews.Content: We stated at this hotel 12/29-1/1/12. We had dinner at Mila. Steve was our waiter and he was amazing. Laura the Bartender at Bar Uncommon made the best drinks and any drink you could imagine she could make. Very impressive. I would say the actual hotel room was average but it is in great location. Very quite hotel like previously posted. Great night sleep and the maids were very respectful and not waking you up earlier in the morning. Our room size was great I am not sure why other complained in previous posts. I rated the value as poor because almost $400.00 for one night stay whether it is for a special event or not is just out of hand. Valet Parking is $33.00 there is self parking in a garage less than a block away for $12.00.

Reviews.Title: “There are better choices”
Reviews.Author: Wladovich
Reviews.Content: I've been to New Orleans many times, stayed at many different hotels. There are better hotel choices including the Renaissance Arts on Tchoupitoulas. The location of the Pere Marquette on Common Street is convenient, just two blocks down to Royal, turn left and you're at perhaps the nicest entry point into the Quarter. However, Common Street is thick with traffic and dark due to the looming tall buildings. As a result the foyer has a cave-like quality to it. I found the front desk staff indifferent but efficient enough I suppose... just not particularly friendly. The concierge was poorly informed, telling one in my group that the Katrina museum in the Quarter was open and free, only to learn after a walk into the Quarter that the museum was closed for the holidays and that there would have been an admission charge. Milo, the restaurant, suffered from the same cave-like, chilly ambience that characterized the foyer. The wait service was checkered. One morning the wait for breakfast was so long that the manager finally appeared, apologetic, and gave us a couple breakfasts on the house. Perhaps the worst aspect of our stay was the parking. The wait for our vehicle was at least 15 minutes and we had to be physically there to call for it. This was the worst parking service of any hotel I have ever stayed at in New Orleans, and I've stayed at a fair number. The hotel isn't awful. The rooms are quiet, but don't expect a view. It's convenient to the Quarter and to the museums and galleries in the warehouse district, but there are better choices. As a Marriott frequent flyer, I would recommend the JW or the Renaissance Arts instead, or even the Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “new orleans hotel”
Reviews.Author: flushing
Reviews.Content: stayed for two nights late december. the hotel is one block from the french quarter. it is a quiet street and a well maintained hotel. the king sized rooms are large and the bathrooms have all the modern conveniences. one of the major pluses for the hotel is the restaurant MiLa. the breakfast which was included in our hotel price was excellent. the supper likewise was excellent. there is a bargain lunch menu we did not try.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. TERRIBLE service!!!”
Reviews.Author: AndarinGallardo
Reviews.Content: As soon as as we got here the service was terrible. We were "warned" about being bumped to a smaller room and that that was "all they had" (we had booked our room 4 months in advance). There is no free wifi (they tell you there's asignal at the lobby but it just doesnt work). I would never recommend this hotel to anyone if you could get another option in a similar location. If you dont care about not having a free internet connection then this is an ok option. The lobby and location are great but the rest lacks everything!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location ... reasonable rate!!”
Reviews.Author: ImportedTexan
Reviews.Content: After researching the internet this place had the best prices and close enough to all the action. It was about a block from Canal Street. Cross the street at Canal and there is Bourbon Street. We didn't receive our robes like their website said was included. No biggie and I'm sure if we called the front desk they would have given it to us. As soon as we left that evening for Bourbon Street the doorman asked if we needed help in directions for wherever we needed to go. Staff was awesome! I woke up with a hangover the next morning and ordered room service which consisted of a fruit tray and water. That was $32 ... yikes!! I may have to bring my own breakfast next time since we did have a mini fridge in the room. I really can't complain much about this place except the very expensive room service and breakfast. We would probably come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christina223
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Pere Marquette in Sept 2011, unfortunately the same weekend that Tropical Storm Lee was in town. The hotel was great though, easy check in and check out, the room was clean with a great view. The only thing I think they could work on was their concierge service, we asked about a few things and they could not help us, also gave us bad info on the trolley when it was not working that day because of the pending storm, I would just think they would have up to date information. Location is good, nice and quiet, especially when you want a break from Bourbon Street. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: lmb32
Reviews.Content: Good location, convenient to FQ. Opted for a small room, queen bed with stall shower and flat screen TV. This was $30 less than normal size room, worth it for me since I spent time only sleeping in the room. Comfortable and adequate for my needs. Good

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TLHenry
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location for our stay in New Orleans. Close enough to Bourbon street for a quick walk over but far away where the noise is not an issue. Our rooms were small but VERY CLEAN and comfortable. The staff was wonderful and helpful in anwering our questions and helped arrange transportation that we needed for attractions that were not close enough to walk to. You do have to valet park but I have no worries about my car being on the street during our stay. Will stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small? Yes. But very modern and cozy.”
Reviews.Author: Tool9031
Reviews.Content: When booking, it was advertised that the rooms were small. They where small but for two people it was perfect! A bar, Starbucks & Mila resteraunt are all located in the well designed lobby. The staff were great and always curtious. Great location and great price! Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful with great location”
Reviews.Author: cherienian
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, gorgeous lobby, nice rooms ( a little on the small side though) and great location to French quarter

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but not what I expect from a Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: momofmombo
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect.. a block from the Fr. Quarter. Quiet street. Hotel Staff could not have been more helpful. However, this hotel is far from what I expect from a Marriott branded hotel. Room was sparsely furnished. 2 double beds could hardly fit us (we were 2 adults and 2 children, one child with each parent).. 2 days into our stay they delivered a bathrobe to our room.. which had a blood stain on it.. YUCK.. Probably wouldn't stay at this hotel again..

Reviews.Title: “Uncommon Bar commonly awful”
Reviews.Author: pucgal
Reviews.Content: We sat in the lounge 20 minutes (12/8 @ 9:30 PM) totally ignored by the bartender. When my husband finally walked up to the bar to inquire as to if we would be waited on, he snapped "If I can ever get out from behind the bar, I'll wait on you." This of course was after he waited on previous customers in the lounge and a group of 3 who arrived 10 minutes after us. Only 5 guests were seated at the bar. What kind of bartender is this?

Reviews.Title: “Needs a little work, but good overall”
Reviews.Author: endicott1
Reviews.Content: I'm giving the hotel a 4 instead of a 3 mainly because of the service and the fair price. My husband and I are frequent guests of Renaissance hotels, so we had certain expectations. The Pere Marquette is in a good location--as everyone has said before, close enough to the action, but far enough away, to get a good night's sleep. The building is old and historic as most are in that area, however, even with that in mind, the hotel needs some sprucing up. Compared to other Renaissance's, this one is very minimalist, almost to a fault. Carpet needs to be replaced throughout the hotel and rooms, the furniture is modern, but not at all luxurious. The lobby was "trendy" but again, not luxurious. We didn't eat at the restaurant, mainly because the hours were fairly limited--which is again, not common for Renaissance--they usually at least have some form of room service throughout the night--especially in a night life town like NO. The bathroom was nicely updated and large, (we did have to ask for a room with a walk in/glass enclosed shower as they are not all like that). We had a corner room with a great view of the city, and as I said, the staff/service was very good. Any requests we had were addressed immediately, and they also followed-up to make sure everything was to our satisfcation. Would I stay again? Maybe. But I think I'd give another one of the hotels a try first.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Pere Marquette a nice place”
Reviews.Author: bigedco
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely situated one block off of Canal and Burbon St. It was nice and safe basically right where it's happening. The room was nice and the staff couldn't be nicer. The lobby is new. You are really one block off of Burbon St and there are plenty of places to eat. I know most people flock to afe Du Monde, but an interesting treat was found nearby in the French Market About 1/2 way in there is a little stand that mades up apple fritters. They ARE AMAZING. They batter apple slices and frie them up, simple but great. The only things not positive were that the wi-fi is not set up for an ipad, not a deal breaker. For platnum or gold members the consierge was closed and breakfast is not provided.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DDBSB
Reviews.Content: I've stayed over for two nights. Check-in staff was very nice, welcoming and pro-active in handing out maps and brochures of the city. The hotel is clean and well kept. Room size was good and the shower was great. I missed the contents of the mini-bar. Location is excellent - close enough to the French Quarter but not in the middle of the action/noise. Lobby bar was good but service was a bit slow. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beth J
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night, November 13, after a cruise. We arrived at 9:30am and were given a room immediately. Did not have to wait until afternoon to check in. The room was large, clean and very comfortable. They could use some new pillows - very thin. The staff very very pleasant and helpful. Excellent location. Close to the French Quarter but away from the noise. Free internet in lobby only.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: angoango
Reviews.Content: We started our weekend at the Courtyard on Julia st....but moved after the first night because of the streetcar noise all night. We were not disappointed! This place is worth the extra block or two walk! The Lobby and rooms were pretty, the wifi worked very well and we were very happy overall with the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: cnote1500
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in early November, 2011. The lobby is very nice and has a coffee shop which serves Starbucks. The lobby bar, Bar Uncommon, is spectacular. Very hip space and some of the best cocktails in the city. My room was stylish, spacious and comfortable. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was clean and beautiful with a wonderful shower. The housekeepers even folded the clothes I left on my suitcase! The front desk left a little to be desired. I checked in with a different credit card than I made the reservation with only to find out they didn't change the card that the charges would go to. They should have asked when I checked in. Aside from that minor problem I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, what more can you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: JM1212
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night during the week. The hotel itself is very clean. The valet was wonderful and friendly. We arrived an hour before check in, but it was not a problem. Our room was one king sized bed, the bed frame stuck out almost a foot, so I now have bruised and bleeding shins, so that is a huge downside.Our room was clean. I especially appreciated the Aveda shampoo/conditioner/soap/body lotion. There was a lighted makeup mirror in our room, but it did not work when I plugged it in. I called the front desk and they had someone bring anew one up within five minutes. I called congrigere once to ask a question, I was told she was talking to someone and she would call me right back. Never got that phone call. The matreess was very comfortable, as were the pillows. I do think it's quite a rip off that the pay per view movies are $16.99, come on!We had fast check in and fast check out. Overall, the hotel was nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in New Orleans and great last minute change”
Reviews.Author: Paolo01
Reviews.Content: I changed to the Pere Marquette at the last minute from another Marriott property which was not downtown. I am very glad that I did. I arrived on a Monday for a business trip and stayed through Wednesday. The bar was very nice and was running a Monday night football beer special and it is hard to not love $5 draft beers. I read a lot of complaints about Renaissance bars, but I really enjoyed this one. Parking in NOLA is hard and expensive and the valet parking at the Pere Marquette was no exception. It does have unlimited access to your car, however, the staff which ran the valet was SLOW. Definitely order your car early and then double check that they are working to retrieve the car. Rooms were nice and very Renaissance. My room was an ADA room. I did not ask for it, and I chose not to get moved. Normally I do not like the ADA rooms if there are standard ones available. I just find the rooms to large and empty for all of the access they create. My largest pet peeve with Renaissance hotels, which I did not realize seems to be the rule, is the no room wifi. They have free LAN connected internet if you are a rewards member, however, no wifi. They do have wifi in the lobby. I like to sit in the recliner or on the bed or on the couch while I work. I am not always confined to the desk by their one meter LAN cable. Oh, I had to have my billing corrected as it was charged on my final bill. No problem getting it dropped off. I did not use the restaurant as I love going out to eat in NOLA and the restaurant just looked expensive and not that different. Location! The location is super convenient for the French Quarter (one block off of Canal). That was the reason for my last minute change and I am very glad that I did seek the change. I would stay here again next time with no hesitation. Hit the bar, I think that you will be surprised at how nice it is and reasonably priced. If I could change anything about the bar, I would add a few more TV's. They were showing the Monday night football game, however, there was not other TV showing the World Series.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff, wonderful beds.”
Reviews.Author: oceanbreezes7
Reviews.Content: The location is just a block off Canal, so we walked almost everywhere. The hotel is very modern, just as it's website shows. I didn't think the king size room was too small, but it wasn't huge either. The bathroom was a nice size, and very clean. The pool is more for lounging, and gets lots of early afternoon shade since it is on the 3rd floor deck, and surrounded by taller buildings. The staff was really friendly, and the bartender was extemely professional. I had a late night creme brulee and it was the best I have ever had. It had a rich mocha flavor. We would stay here again. Paid $105./night on priceline. The going rate was over $200.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: anneeliz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one block from Canal Street and the Quarter. The hotel is very quiet and a short, safe walk to the French Quarter. The hotel is older, but well maintained. Many of the rooms have funky shapes, and my collegues' rooms were slightly larger or smaller than mine. The conference rooms were pretty standard. The staff was typical of most Marriott properties: very friendly and helpful with recommendations for dinner and tours. There were plenty of cabs outside most of the day, and when the front desk had to call a cab late at night, the cab arrived within a few short minutes. I was in NOLA for a conference at the hotel, but I did get out to experience Bourbon Street in the evening. It was nice to return to a quiet hotel that was a block or two away from the madness on Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: LauraE10
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is fabulous! It was close enough to walk to everything we wanted to see, but far enough from all the noise so we could sleep. We had a room with 2 double beds since they didn't have any rooms left with a king. The beds were a bit smaller then what we were used to, but they were soooo comfortable! I loved the Aveda amenities, but they gave us a used half bottle of lotion, which was odd. Everyone who worked there always had a smile and greeted us very warmly. The lobby was beautiful and very modern. We didn't get to make it out to the pool, but it looked nice and relaxing. This place was very clean and very well maintained, and did I mention how we loved the location?

Reviews.Title: “Stay here often, consistently satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Havamama
Reviews.Content: We travel to New Orleans frequently (several times a year), and we almost always stay at the Pere Marquette. We love the location, which is close to the French Quarter but not in the Quarter and also right on the Streetcar line for easy access to the Garden District and City Park. The hotel is lovely--modern, with a boutique feel. A couple of downsides: they skimp on the towels, charge for WiFi and parking. (I'll tolerate one or the other but the two together makes this hotel not such a great value.)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, modern, clean & beautiful decors. Great location, friendly staffs”
Reviews.Author: MichelleNgo
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel thru the discount site for hotel Priceline.com 3 times everytime we need hotel in the New Orleans area. So your best bet is to try book it thru this. Worth every dollars if not more! Great location, not too far, not too close from all the main fanfares...Beautiful, modern, clean decors thru out the hotel. We got there late, but the staffs were very friendly & helpful. You asked anything, they will always have answers for it & was happy to do so (I realized that this is pretty much how local New Orleans people are) Rooms are clean, stocked with enough essentials for your stays. House keeping staffs stay on top of thing if you run into them at the hallway, they will ask you if everything ok or if you need anything (dont see that in everywhere we go) We used the hotel restaurant everytime we here, and got the best service everytime. Beautifully decored, friendly & attentive staffs. Their breakfast is great w. awesome bakery!!! We love the chocolate filled croissant :) Staffs at the bar was nice too. Can't say enuf nice things about people work here. <3 Highly recommended. Try to find it thru discount site of Priceline. Come & enjoy the beautiful hotel, its friendly staffs & awesome New Orleans area. PS: valet parking is a bit expensive ($22/day) which if u ok to walk a bit, u will save a little money, but since we got good rate w. the room, we didn't mind just park here for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Would go again if prices remain reasonable”
Reviews.Author: cdgas
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel. A little smaller than what we are used to when in New Orleans but the price was right. It's not right in the French Quarter but is close enough for walking distance to the French Quarter

Reviews.Title: “Honestly; near perfect :)”
Reviews.Author: bowman716
Reviews.Content: My experience with other New orleans hotels has been inflated star levels and quirky to sub-par service. The Renaissance is a true 4 star property that would compete favorably with larger, more expensive (4.5 to 5.0 star) hotels in the area. My 5 day experience highlights: Got a great rate from an online discount site. All employees I encountered were very friendly and totally professional. Was allways greeted and appreciated. Public areas are comfortable, beautiful and well maintained. On sight restaurant was equally beautiful with personable service, delicious modern food and reasonably priced. Guest room was nice but more basic and lacking any design elements/colors from the public areas/lobby. Everything worked in the room, quality bed/linens, clean, Aveda bath products and good lighting throughout. Location is perfect and rather quite. 2 blocks to the French Quarter. Only had a couple issues. Air conditioning in room made regular loud slamming sounds making it difficult to sleep with it on. TV On-Demand options were weak compared to other hotel brands. $12.95 a day for internet is stupid! I would totally recommend this Renaissance to other travels. I had an excellent experience...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, comfortable bed, professional and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: derailed3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased a favorable Priceline "Name Your Price" deal and was placed at the Renaissance on a spontaneous New Orleans trip. The hotel's interior is beautifully designed and the atmosphere was very relaxing. When we checked in, we were treated in a very professional and friendly manner. Our room was impeccably clean when we arrived. The only problem I could find with the cleanliness was there was a faint stain on their marble sink from ages ago. The location was fabulous, allowing us to simply walk around the block and across the street to the French Quarter. We did not park at the hotel, opting to avoid the $32.80/night valet parking charge and instead parked two blocks away at a place that was $12/night. Just beware that some places do not allow you to enter or leave after certain times. If you're planning on walking your whole trip, that's not a problem, of course. We did not use the pool, although it looked well-maintained. We did not eat at the restaurant nor sit at the bar, so I can't speak for those either. Really, we didn't do very much at the Renaissance besides sleep, but it was a luxurious experience that we wouldn't hesitate to recommend or take advantage of if we have the same opportunity to stay again at a discounted price.

Reviews.Title: “Rudest front desk staff I have ever encountered”
Reviews.Author: The_Savvy_Traveler85
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a nightmare stay at this property. The room was quiet and quite nice. However, the hotel front desk staff on Saturday night were the rudest, least professional Marriott employees I have ever encountered. We had TWO rooms because our twenty-something daughters were with us for a wedding. They checked in before us, and when we checked in, we were really clear that OUR credit card was paying for these rooms. They somehow charged everything to my grad student daughter's card, which was over her limit! Instead of clarifying this, the Horror Woman locked us both out of our rooms, rolled her eyes at me while I was trying to resolve the situation and made my daughter cry and humilated her in front of her boyfriend. The hotel messed up, and then Ms. Attitude with the rolling eyes insulted us, implied we were criminals and was nastier than anyone I have dealt with in ANY hotel I have ever stayed in. It put a real damper on our stay. We are former New Orleanians, and understand that many natives hate tourists. But if that is the case, get another job. I think Marriott ought to be ashamed of themselves for this one...we're reward members and have always been delighted with how we have been treated. Oh, and they gouge you for parking.
