I know they have no control over the other guests, but the quality of people staying there was dreadful. Won't go back there!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with terrible parking”
Reviews.Author: marygraham
Reviews.Content: After finding the hotel and admiring their antique flashing parking sign, our first impression was not a great one. Upon arriving we sat in our car on the street for nearly ten minutes before I got out to find out what the trouble was. In front of us were five completely empty cars sitting with their engines running. This hotel only has expensive (fee: $32.48) valet parking and the valets were milling around not doing much when I inquired as to the hold up. The one I spoke with said they needed to move the cars. He said something to another guy who was just standing around at the valet window and magically they got in the cars and started taking them upstairs to the parking. We waited just another couple minutes for them to get the cars out of the way so we could enter the parking area and get out. Once inside, the lobby, we loved the four (I think it was 4) vignettes they have set up across from the MiLa Bar. They were very inviting and cozy (though we did not have time to partake). Check in was a breeze and the two ladies were very pleasant. Upon arriving at our room, we found it quite chilly! The temp was down to 68 degrees - but that was easily fixed. The bed was very comfortable, but their small pillows left much to be desired. The bathroom was very large with a nice walk-in shower. There was no problem with two of us using the sink & mirror at the same time. The side panel on the shower did leak at the bottom onto the floor, but it was not a huge issue. There was absolutely no view out our window. We were on the 14th floor and could not even see the street because the building next door was so close - all we could see was into their windows - so we just kept the sheers closed. Upon leaving, we had another round with the valet. It took them nearly fifteen minutes to retrieve our car! When it was finally coming down the one-car-wide ramp, there were two other cars headed up, which both had to reverse to let our car out. I'm not sure why there is so much standing around of the valets - they don't immediately move cars when someone gets out!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sunnydzr
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at this property in Dec 2009. In planning another trip to New Orleans I remembered this place and how great it was and thought I would right a long overdue review. The hotel is very modern and stylish, as are the rooms. In addition, the rooms were quite spacious, the bed was very comfortable and the bath products were nice (Aveda I believe) The lobby bar was very cool, not very busy but the bartenders were great and very knowledgeable. We did not eat at the property or order room service so I'm unable to comment. The location was nice, we went for a football game at the Superdome so we were able to walk there and also walk to the french quarter which was up the street. We would definitely stay again for the price this place was very nice with a great location!

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter ambiance without steep price”
Reviews.Author: kevyleo80
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here just after new years eve 2010. This is the hotel we received after bidding for a hotel just oustide the French Quarter. We tried several fair bids for a hotel inside the French Quarter but could not get anything. I am very glad things turned out this way. I got an amazing price for a luxurious hotel. The location is great. Walking distance to the French Quarter and with also next to cafes. There is also a starbucks in the lobby and a restaurant adjoining. The lobby is incredibly ornate and decorative. Great attention to detail had us taking photos of the lobby. It was one of a kind. The staff at the front desk provided excellent service. No problems checking in or checking out. There is a pool, although it was too cold outside to use during our stay. The room is small but decorated such that it is more cozy and welcoming. Overall I was very impressed and we enjoyed our stay immensely with much thanks to our stay here. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location, Customer Service Could be Better”
Reviews.Author: CorrieCross
Reviews.Content: I came here for my bachelorette party. We had an absolute blast. This hotel added to the fun. It is GORGEOUS on the inside. The lobby was fabulous. Our room had modern decor and was fun to stay in! It did take us a few minutes to get our rooms because of some sort of computer problem, but after that, we were fine. Also, I got a little irritated that one of the hotel workers stood in the hallway and waiting for us to leave so she could clean the room. She made it obvious that we were annoying her by taking so long. Other than that, this is a great hotel. It's about a 5 minute walk to Bourbon St.

Reviews.Title: “Understated & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Solana75
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pere Marquette Hotel middle of July. This hotel is a real gem: out of the French Quarter but within walking distance, clean comfortable room, quiet and top quality service. Location and entrance is back a street from Canal and easy to access. The reception area couldn't be more welcoming, it was right when you walked in and the front desk staff remembered our names throughout our stay. There is a small lounge area adjacent to the elevators that was well stocked but not open during the day, also a small area for coffee and breakfast items. The barrista is especially nice! We stayed on a $99/night special and the room we were given was very comfortable and larger than most in this area. Room view was of empty buildings, but the Concierge lounge looked over the French Quarter and river and was staffed with the most accomodating person who made everyone feel welcome. Weather for this time of year is unsettled and there was rain & sun every day which only added to the 'moodiness' and allure as long as you had an umbrella. The hotel location was ideal for walks within the French Quarter, Warehouse and Central business districts as there are many excellent galleries and restaurants. Walking around the area you could tell that a massive amount of renovation had taken place as most buildings were recently upgraded, painted, redone or all even the unsavory ones. We had one of the best times we could remember this trip. I'd avoid the airport shuttle: wait was too long. Make friends with people on the plane or in the airport and share a cab, you don't want to waste precious time exploring this great place. New Orleans is back and open! Locals are wonderful and have a story to tell that is worth listening to.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: SherrybabyOakdale
Reviews.Content: Fabulous service and amenities. Great location just outside of French quarter in business district near many attractions. Staff was constantly available. I recommend adding the "breakfast package" which includes foods from a 3 star restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Remy8888
Reviews.Content: I have lived in New Orleans and also stayed at many hotels here. The Pere Marquette is fantastic if you want to be close to everything (i.e. French quarter) but stay in a quiet low key hotel. It was so quiet you could hear a pin drop but 2 blocks from entry to the busy French Quarter. The rooms are extremely clean. Fresh crisp soft bed linens, ergonomic desk chair, high ceilings, big windows almost from floor to ceiling which let in a lot of light, Aveda bath products, large shower head, small fridge, large flat screen TV, and comfortable mattress (not too hard and not too mushy). Very funky lobby/bar with lots of little nooks to sit in. The decor in the rooms is somewhat minimalist but I like it better than the busy ostentatiousness that you see in some New Orleans hotels. We were previously in an older historical hotel that had that the typical musty dank odor you sometimes find in N.O. buildings. But we switched over to here after one night and love the boutique feeling. We were so happy to arrive for the next 4 nights! Room service is pricey but like many Marriotts the quality of food was excellent (we just had continental breakfast). The only complaint is that when we pulled up to the front door there was no bellman and no one at the front desk. We had to wander around to find assistance to check in which was annoying, especially when the bar tender didn't seem to want to help us track someone down. The rate was $99. A steal, but then again I guess it is summer. I come for jazz fest every year and have decided this would be the ideal place to stay. Did I say how spotlessly clean this hotel is and how comfy the beds are?

Reviews.Title: “Great rate, unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilfishouttawater
Reviews.Content: Amazing attention to detail, clean, tons of space, friendly staff for the most part (only one exception), great proximity to all the excitement yet quiet. Room service should consider staying open past 11 but Dominoes and Daisy Dukes are right around the corner if you are hungry late.

Reviews.Title: “Good military discount”
Reviews.Author: DWVL
Reviews.Content: We got a great military rate here which made it a good value. We got a corner room so I think it was bigger than most the others, but it was very clean and well decorated. You can't beat the location. Walking distance to everything but far enough away to be quiet at night. We did not use the pool during our stay because there was too much to do! The front desk wasn't very friendly, but the bartender was knowledgeable and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: snowangel888
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, in a great location. It was a bit small, but clean with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Once, I was a rock star”
Reviews.Author: Otic9000
Reviews.Content: The property is clean and hip, the location is within an easy walk to the action, but the hotel is classy and comfortable AND quiet! It was perfect. The restaurant attached, Mila, is delicious, and the staff of the hotel are professional, courteous, and most importantly, happy. Tacy was fantastic, and she made some outstanding recommendations. There is a fun locals breakfast place within a block of the hotel called Hobnobber's. Try it if you are feeling adventurous. It is the real deal! I have really grown to love the Renaissance brand, and this hotel delivers on every level. Thank you, Frank!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: michaela789
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and were overall disappointed. The hotel is nothing special. I've never seen a smaller "pool". The worst part was waking up in the morning with dozens of bug bites. We told the manager and she was very friendly and called in a company to check out the bedding. The company said they found nothing, but I found that hard to believe. I also feel they didn't take the situation serious enough. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: erhof
Reviews.Content: I added a room here at the Renaissance Pere Marquette, because my first hotel was booked up for the last night of my stay. Was I glad I did! This was my favorite of the three hotels I tried in New Orleans. The lobby was very pleasant and spatious. The staff were friendly and accommodating. My room was fantastic with all the amenities I needed as a business traveler. I enjoyed a lovely meal in the restaurant, also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Extras”
Reviews.Author: hpark4
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. The location is perfect, a block west of Canal, a block north of St. Charles. At first the room seemed plain but I really appreciated the super fast elevators, the computer stations just off the lobby, the little refrigerator and the king sized bathrooms. The Pere Marquette is not a high profile hotel but it combined great value and a fine location along with the little extras that make travel fun. It was a great refuge from Jazzfest and the blessed blare of New Orleans nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: charlilley
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance was a nice, well kept, modern hotel. Had an issue with the air-conditioning in the room which was handled immediately and when a resolution could not be made I was given another room (without asking). Customer service was excellent! Great Location! Far enough from the action to have peace while in the hotel and close enough to walk to all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - adequate room”
Reviews.Author: mphopkins99
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location. Within walking distance of the french quarter, but far enough so that the noise of Bourbon Street didnt keep me awake. Room was decent, nothing special. Lobby area is cool, no gift shop to pick up travel items like razor, tootbrush, etc. Staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations.... don't judge the book by it's cover”
Reviews.Author: FtMyersman
Reviews.Content: Get past the outside appearance and this is a great hotel. The room was quiet and well appointed and maintained. Bathroom was perfect, bed comfortable and the room quiet. It is New Orleans and yes there was some short lived revelry in the halls, but the room, 407 where I was staying also had a double door for mine and the room next to me... bonus. Would stay again. Parking is a premium, but if going in and out, keep your car safe and enjoy the great valet service. Starbucks in the lobby is nice too. Rooms are not like the resort rooms in Vegas, but mine was fine, lots of hangers in the closet, room safe etc. No flat screen HD TV, but why are you watching TV in New Orleans? Get out and enjoy the food, music and people!

Reviews.Title: “Cramped trendy hotels belong in NYC”
Reviews.Author: JJnero
Reviews.Content: The good - decor and vibe were modern and happening, but not over the top like some similar hotels, such as some Ws The bad - was guaranteed a king but only got a queen, request for upgrade was declined (despite status); maid try to come in and clean at 8 in the morning; no service elevator so staff take up a lot of space in small elevators The ugly - extremely cramped and awkward layout of rooms (I tried two due to squeaky bed in first) - this is New Orleans, space is not that much of a premium

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: LNguyen24
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel is in a great location - a ten minute walk to the French Quarter and Harrah's, a five minute walk to Canal street and a lot of great restaurants nearby. Hotel: Tasteful modern decor in the lobby and bar/lounge area. There is a starbucks inside the hotel Rooms: We stayed in a double room - the beds are smaller than a full but larger than a queen and not comfortable at all. The bathroom, however, is very large and bright. Value: At $140/night, this is a steal in terms of cleanliness and location Service: This is where the hotel definitely needs to improve. When we checked in, we were told that their system shows we are only booked for one night and their hotel is completely booked for the weekend. Well, we showed our confirmation page and rooms were magically available. The next day we left during the day and when we came back, our cards for both of the rooms we booked were no longer working. We used the phone in the hallway of our floor to notify the front desk of the situation and was told a bell boy would come up and replace our cards. Well, twenty minutes went by and we were getting tired of standing in the hallway so one of my friends went down to see what was going on. Turns out they "forgot about us"! Validia (sp?) the housekeeper on the 10th floor at the time saw how upset we were so she took matters into her own hands and apologized on behalf of the hotel and also offered us champagne. Well an hour or two passed and Validia (sp?) called to check on us and wanted to know if we were enjoying our champagne. We told her that it never came and within 5 minutes there was someone at our door. This hotel would have gotten a very poor rating due to their service but because they have such a great employee such as Validia the housekeeper, I will give them an average rating. Such a shame that a housekeeper had to "clean up" the staff's mess. The valet guys and bell boys were also very friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but uneven room quality”
Reviews.Author: Minnetonkalady
Reviews.Content: We were put into a room which had a common wall with a very noisy elevator shaft. Avoid all rooms ending in 01. The desk moved us to a much better room, which made me realize the uneven quality of the rooms. This is a decent place if you get a good price. Staff is very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “OverPriced clausterphobic room where basics are extra”
Reviews.Author: greatovenmitt
Reviews.Content: This was a mistake. Small clausterphobic room where bedside tables are crammed with coffeemaker & clock, no view, only valet parking for 29.95 extra, internet extra at 12.95, no breakfast, only one large bath towel per room,old tube tv that is blurry. Bath floods when you take a shower since curtain is cloth, so you almost break your neck on the flooded marble floor. Spent time mopping with the few towels provided. Nightmare unloading from car since no room to maneuver & Have to have a bell hop since it's urgent to get out in one trip to move car for line behind you. Everytime you want to get something from car have to involve a valet to get it. If you park around corner in alternate $13.95 a night lot ,it's a scary nightmare since only one lane in & out of garage and have to back up thru garage if someone coming in/out. This is on Common St which is very city-like with highrises. Would rather stay around convention center and walk a few blocks or take trolley.(This room price was much higher than other places in area that had larger suites with digital tv,internet,breakfast& cheaper accessible parking.) Tries to appear a luxury hotel but misses the mark.

Reviews.Title: “poor night sleep”
Reviews.Author: 5252orange
Reviews.Content: the main problem with staying anywhere near the quarter is the hotels become a frat house after midnight. our floor was graced with about 20 early twentysomethings who treated the floor like one big party room until roughly 4:30am. security was called twice to no avail.

Reviews.Title: “Conveneient location”
Reviews.Author: miboth
Reviews.Content: The hotel appeared to be brand new. Spacious rooms and excellent staff. Within walking distance if reasonably fit to French Quarter and Bourbon Street. Only negative was price of parking but that may be par for the course in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated at four stars”
Reviews.Author: travlinlite319
Reviews.Content: Not a four star hotel. Small over the top disjointed modern lobby decor; stark, bland rooms; poor exterior appearance with dated and confusing sign. Check in at the very small reception desk was pleasant but involved an attempt by clerk to give us a room at a higher and scenic level for an additional charge. Parking was $29.95 per night but that may be the going rate in the area. On the plus side the place was clean and safe and the staff was friendly. The hotel is on a quiet but somewhat unattractive side street one block from Bourbon (the French Quarter) and Canal. A very good location for visiting and dining the French Quarter and having a great brunch at the Court of Two Sisters.

Reviews.Title: “Thought this would be more upscale, but disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: kherb43
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent price for this on Priceline, but the parking fees were so high it cancelled the savings out. Excellent location. They are trying to be an upscale hotel, but the room amenities were lacking. Old tube television, and you had to pay for internet access. Unheard of these days. We enjoy hotels that offer free breakfasts--- this one does not-- so that also adds to the cost. We enjoyed the fruit-flavored water in the lobby, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: lolarobot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pere Marquette over Halloween. The whole trip was a blast! The hotel itself was gorgeous. The lobby was stunning, the staff helpful and the rooms spacious and comfortable. The washrooms were particularly large. LOCATION: Great location on the outer area of the French Quarter. Walking distance to all the fun on Bourbon St and all the shops and areas of the French Quarter. Took about 15-20 min to walk to the cemetery and you can catch the trolly close by to get to the Garden Dist. It is on a quiet side street away from the insanity, so it made for a pleasant sleep. There is a really great restaurant around the corner that is open 24/7. They have amazing shrimp po boy's for a great price! As well, you are about a 5 min walk from a Walgreens and a 2min walk from a convenience store, which makes life easy if you need anything. ROOMS: Rooms are nice and large. Clean and great bedding. I had a wonderful sleep. The washrooms are large and there is enough closet space to hang everything. HOTEL: The lobby and lobby bar are gorgeous. Great decor and it always smells amazing! STAFF: Very friendly and helpful. Great with directions and getting you checked in and out. TIPS: The restaurant around the corner (Daisy Duke's Express) is open 24/7 and has great shrimp po boy's at a good price. They are huge and packed full of shrimpy goodness. Their jambalaya and rice and beans is also inexpensive and delicious. Great for a late night snack!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dennysdimples
Reviews.Content: Quite lovely hotel located on Common St. one block off of Canal and one block walk to Bourbon St.. Stayed for New Year's Eve it was great location since we didn't have to walk very far. Rooms are very nice but noise level from hallway and other rooms could be heard through the walls, as well as sirens and revelers from street below and we were on the 8th floor. There is no wi-fi available for computers. But you can "plug in" for a fee in your room. The "queen" size beds are actually full size. The parking fee is $29 plus tax so ended up being $37. The "special event rate" with it being new year's eve is pretty high. But all in all would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel...but some issues”
Reviews.Author: Steve_and_Megann
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights here the week before Christmas. The good...location, right off Canal St, near the French Quarter, St Charles Streetcar; the bed and amenities were good quality, the front desk and concierge staff were friendly and helpful; the price was great ($114/nt, including breakfast for 2) The not so good...carpet and furnishing were a bit worn; sat in the bar for 20 minutes and the bartender didn't even notice we were there, so ordered a bottle of wine from room service which took 2 calls and 45 minutes; water took forever to heat up, and then didn't last long. None of these things was terrible, but they could have done better. We will send a note to the manager to give him our perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful decor, friendly and helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: 18Travel1
Reviews.Content: Came for a 4-day weekend getaway. The room was very clean, spacious, elegant, calming, and quiet. The bathroom was gorgeous. The hotel is scented with a beautifully floral breezy scent. The staff are very friendly and ready to answer all your questions. Great proximity to the French Quarter, easy access to the street car down St. Charles to see the Garden District. Highly recommended. Best mini-trip in a long time, and our relaxing hotel was the biggest contributing factor.

Reviews.Title: “Noise from the street is ridiculus!”
Reviews.Author: Mamanaquin
Reviews.Content: I am laying awake At 11:58 pm after traveling several hours and just want to relax and go to sleep because we have a long day ahead of us tomorrow. Right now I hear a VERY loud muscle car revving up it's engine, the screeching sounds from the street car on Canal Street. People on the streets hollering, horns going off, it's crazy!! The walls must be paper thin! I will request another room in the morning and depending if they will accomodate, my overall rating could improve or get worse. It's now 12:02 am & the noise is constant!

Reviews.Title: “Great Food, Best Bartender! Old Televisions!”
Reviews.Author: SGDOSM
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed stay (even the with the electric outage). Chris the mixologist was one of the best I've encountered on the road (and his lovely bride-assistant). Great meal in Mila, but when dining alone, I prefer to sit at the bar. I did so in Mila and it was a very sterile experience. Was disappointed to learn that I could not order from that menu in Chris' bar. Otherwise would have enjoyed a second meal. Instead had two great meals at the bars of Luke and Domenica-much more appealing atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location â€“ solid and professional 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wembleygal
Reviews.Content: I am sometimes puzzled by the reviews on Trip Advisor, especially the negative ones regarding this particular property. I thought that the staff were very friendly and helpful. Check-in was effortless. The lobby area had a good vibe. The location is close to the French Quarter, but without the noise. It felt very safe. The dÃ©cor in the room was a little boring and a flat-screen TV would have been nice, but overall, the room was very comfortable. The room was a good size and very clean. Sleep quality was excellent. I had no problems with the shower strength and the water was always a good temperature. The Aveda bathroom products were lovely. Concierge lounge was small, but the staff were excellent, and there was a good assortment of food for breakfast. The evening nibbles (which start at 5:00 PM) were varied. Ask one of the attendants for the free wifi code. There is also free wifi in the lobby, as well as 2 computers near the Starbucks (although they do get busy first thing in the morning and the computers are a bit slow), in addition, there is a computer near the front desk, where you can print your boarding pass. A cab from the airport will set you back $33 plus tip. There are always lots of taxis waiting outside of the hotel. The pool area was small but charming -- very clean and well maintained. While in NOLA you should try one of the cemetery tours â€“ great fun. A big thank you to GM Frank and his staff â€“ I would definitely return to this solid 4-star property.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good”
Reviews.Author: raftar99
Reviews.Content: Located just a block away from Bourbon street. Really neat rooms. Very very courteous staff. My room was not ready, so they immediately made alternate arrangements and put me in a bigger room. The bar & a small kitchen are open pretty late. One block from Canal street, viz., more like the "main street". A short walk from the convention center and other major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Solid and a good deal...if you play your cards right.”
Reviews.Author: FlyingToast
Reviews.Content: There is a sharply reduced rate available on this hotel, but you usually need to reserve it well in advance (knowing the dates of Veterans' Day weekend, which is a slow time for me at work, I decided to reserve about six months in advance). Not sure if I'd be as thrilled at the full rate. You get a slightly smaller room at that rate, but not miniscule, and it's quiet since it's just off the Quarter. Easy to walk around CBD and the Quarter, staff was very cool, easy to print out a boarding pass, and all the other basics are done pretty well. Solid if unspectacular.

Reviews.Title: “We got a great deal”
Reviews.Author: ANTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance because we caught a nice special on Orbitz and got a great deal for a 4 star hotel. The hotel was very modern compared to other hotels in the area. Hotel was very clean and close to the Quarter. It was a 2 block walk to Bourbon St. right off of Canal. Walk home was safe and the area was quiet compared to the FQ. No need to pay for internet in the room since you can just bring your laptop down to the lobby or use 1 of their 2 computers in the lobby for internet. There is a bar and restaurants in the hotel but very pricey. Overall for the price we paid we got a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Not Marriott's finest...”
Reviews.Author: SD_RnrGrl
Reviews.Content: I am a very frequent business and leisure traveler. I have high - but not unreasonable - expectations for hotels of this level. While the location is great (just off the French Quarter) and the lobby is nicely decorated and inviting, that is where the goodness ends. Our room had broken/missing bathroom hardware/shelving; there was garbage and old service trays left in the hallways and elevator areas for far longer that should be acceptable; there is no WiFi in the rooms (and the WiFi in the common areas was painfully slow; and with one exception, the hotel staff was not friendly. I would only stay in this hotel if you are able to get a super deal/package.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Best Marriott I have stayed in this year.”
Reviews.Author: shafet
Reviews.Content: I travel significantly for work and 90% of the time stay at Marriott properties. This hotel was by far the best marriott expereince I have had this year. The check in staff was extremely helpful, the room was spotless and well appointed, and the location of the hotel was prefect. Far enough, but not too far from the fray --- Bourbon St. I will def. be staying here next year when I return to NOLA. I just loved this property and attention by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay Downtown New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: TexanXXL
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at this Hotel. It was in the very middle of down town and had a great local grocery store within a bolk walking distance that is open 24 hours a day. I was going to a meeting after several days here and had brought along some suits that needed cleaning. They had a great laundry service and everyone were very nice to us. We ate at teh Delmonico resturant during our stay and we were at the French Quarter most of the time. I loved it. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel, A Restful Break to the New Orleans Vibe”
Reviews.Author: NC-member
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good, about 3-4 blocks from Bourbon Street, which is a quiet distance. Check-in was fine, I had read earlier TA reviews and requested a corner room, which provided slightly more space. Stayed in room 416, it overlooked the pool (tranquil) and had nice views of adjacent buildings. Bed was comfortable, bathroom was adequate size. There was a desk and chair, a cabinet with a t.v. No club chair or side table, which I missed. Linens were of good quality. Room appeared to be very clean. It was surprising that we would have to pay $15/day for wifi, (seriously?) so we went to the lobby for wifi access (free). That was irritating. There was a fridge and coffee maker. Hotel restaurant (Mila) was very good, I highly recommend it. Ate there for a (late) dinner from arriving from the airport. Food was excellent. It was the best meal we had during our four-night stay. I wish I had know that, but will remember next time. Lobby was nice, very cool and comfortable with lots of couches and pillows, etc. A Starbucks nearby. Overally, nice hotel, not a lot of amenities, but a safe and quiet homebase to tour New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly four-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: FelineFan
Reviews.Content: The Pere Marquette was an extraordinary value for the deal I got on Priceline ($60/night in mid-October). Staffers were friendly and professional. Location was terrific for us -- just outside the French Quarter and only a few blocks from Lafayette Square, site of the blues fest we were in town to attend. Bathroom was huge and nicely appointed, although I did learn I don't want a rainfall-type shower head (it worked fine, but I like a stronger waterflow). The only problem I had was in trying to communicate with the housekeeper that I didn't want fresh linens -- just the bed made up. I ended up with no bottom sheet atop the mattress topper due to the language misunderstanding. (The hotel lacked cards to put on the beds to request no fresh linens.) The room was nicely decorated in a clean, modern style but it could have used a comfy chair or two (space was certainly available) -- the only non-bed seat was a desk chair. Valet parking was pricey at $29/night, but convenient and not a whole lot higher than garages a block or two away -- and I was willing to pay for the convenience. Bellmen and concierges were terrific, as was the front desk personnel. Despite my nit-picking (and they were only nits -- certainly nothing major), I'd happily recommend the Pere Marquette to anyone looking for a great place to stay in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Only would stay again if I booked on Priceline for $85 a night”
Reviews.Author: TravelDiva10_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. The lobby is great however there are many flaws... #1 is they consider themselves to be a four star hotel charging $199-219 a night when you cant even get complimenty breaskfast for this price #2 there should be free wi-fi access in all the rooms.. .When I think of four star I think of majority of everything included. #3 they charge $50 a day for incidentals now that is outrageous. Me and my bf lucked up because the front desk staff added in breakfast for free (I recommend asking ;) ) & she didnt take my card for incidentals GOOD PART---- its very close to Canal and Bourbon Street in only a few blocks away from all the great souvenir shops and great restaurants! Near Cvs and Walgreens on Canal which was also a plus... The beds were so comfy when we were not out on Bourbon street we relaxed in the room! I would only come back if I got the great rate again on Priceline otherwise there are so many other great hotels in close proximity

Reviews.Title: “Very Trendy Decor and Friendly Staff - Close to the Action”
Reviews.Author: MsTexasKim
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the staff was very friendly and helpful. They put us in a small room with an akward bulkhead so my hubby had to swoop to not bump his head. They immediately move us to another room. Most of the rooms are small, but they whole hotel has been completely remodeled and is now very upscale and modern. The gym was great and the hotel location was excellent. Walking distance to the Quater, but quiet enough to relax. The parking was expensive, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: RadWife73
Reviews.Content: Husband and I are frequent travelers to New Orleans, and more often than not we book our rooms on Priceline. A recent stay was no exception to that, and we got a great rate on a room at the Renaissance Pere Marquette which was a new hotel for us. If we had to pay full price though, I doubt I would be as pleased. Positives: Lobby is modern, clean, and impressive; free wireless in the lobby; nice gym (although very crowded in the a.m., probably because this hotel seems to cater to the business traveler/conference attendees); Quiet; Conveniently located; Friendly employees and great service; Coffee available in room; Aveda products; Clean rooms; Laundry facilities in the gym. Negatives: Rooms and hallways in obvious need of updating/repair (torn carpets, wallpaper, old tv, etc.), although the room was clean; Hot water hit or miss, seemed to be plentiful in the morning but not in the afternoons/early evenings when lukewarm was as hot as it would get. Overall, it was a nice stay, and I would not hesitate to stay here again, IF the price is right. On a side note, the restaurant, MiLa, is excellent. They have a 3 course lunch special for $20 (many NOLA restaurants have wonderful lunch specials).

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel is better than first impressions”
Reviews.Author: travelingdoc42
Reviews.Content: First impressions of this boutique type hotel were not good: street looks like an alley with construction& lots of abandoned buildings,no doorman, juggling bags through manual doors with no help in sight, inadequate number of staff to check-in in a reasonable time, tiny check in area, small elevator, weak shower, very plain cheap furnishings in room, old fashioned ( not flat panel HD) TV, no Wi-Fi in rooms , coffee maker located far away from any place to plug it in, bathroom door which slammed shut, etc. But then the place kind of grew on us: Location was close to everything, these types of streets and abandoned buildings are common and part of charm of New Orleans, if cab had dropped us off in motor lobby ( instead of at street entrance) there were fine automatic doors (note: be sure & have cab drop you off a motor lobby/parking entrance if you have bags), the lounge area leading to check in area was quite nice, what staff there was tried hard & was knowledgeable, some elevators were normal size & elevators usually came fairly quickly, when asked staff quickly fixed shower ( clogged strainer in shower head assemblyâ€¦..be sure to check shower when you arrive & ask them to fix if it is poor) and bathroom door, TV reception & picture were good (though we did miss AMC channel), hard line internet service was fine & free to elite guests, coffee maker was on tray & ,while inconvenient , we did find a place to plug it in (electric outlets were, in general, poorly placed and there were not enough of them near desk), bed was quite comfortable ( we slept very well), maid service was prompt & quite good, room was not huge but big enough and concierge lounge, while smallish , was quite good(eggs & bacon plus usual continental breakfast stuff in AM, a hot dish & fresh baked cookies in evening) - and ladies staffing it were excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great New Orleans Option at a great value”
Reviews.Author: mikeloveshotels
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great surprise. Most of the hotels in New Orleans are old fashioned, so it was nice to stay in a more modern authentic boutique hotel. The rooms are very comfortable. Beds are great....no flat panel tv;s though or ipod docks...that would make the rooms even more perfect. Aveda bath products- great....bath terry's just blah. Water pressure left alot to be desired. Other than that, the rooms were immaculate, decor was fresh, and our room was actually huge. Our friends were not as lucky..their rooms were smaller. The staff was really nice, and the pool is not worth going to. Lastly, the location is great...in walking distance to everything, and really great to be close to the Canal St Line. Go Eat at the Port of Call all the way at the end of the Quarter..best burger ever!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Vacation-Reviewer14
Reviews.Content: Booked a package through Jet Blue. Great value for non-stop flight with hotel included. Very reasonable. Hotel is one block in from Canal Street at the edge of the French Quarter. Essentially across the street from the Roosevelt (a Waldorf Astoria hotel) and a block from the Ritz Carlton (on Canal Street). Rooms and bathroom extremely clean and comfortable. Aveda products in the bathroom. Our room was a corner room on the 18th floor and had two full walls of windows with a peek a boo view of the river. Complimentary breakfast is available for those who stay on the 17th, 18th, or 19th floor in the lounge on the 19th floor. You must use your key card to get in. Hotel has a fitness center and a pool. Staff a great help with recommendations and anything else you need. Free computer access in the lobby. Lobby decorated beautifully. There is a restaurant (Mila) in the hotel which is supposed to be great although we did not eat there. The French Quarter and Riverwalk are easily accessible and walkable. The St. Charles streetcar is only two blocks away and will take you to the Garden District and Uptown. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do-Over please”
Reviews.Author: 20inchmo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and you will pay for it. Stayed here Feb. 13th thru 16th for Mardi Gras, hotel is just 1 block from parade route. If you have never been this is very important in terms of relieving yourself and being able to get back to your room easliy. The hotel defintely takes advantage of its location by charging an arm and a leg for an otherwise mediocre hotel. The lobby areas are gorgeous just as the promotional pics illustrate. The rooms however (or my room) was small, old and worn out (if you know what I mean). But again, the location trumps it all. We took a cab to the hotel from the airport for $30 and ate locally. We did have their buffet breakfast on the day of checkout for $18pp. It was pricey but good. In terms of getting around we walked everywhere, I never did see the trolleys that were advertised. The French Quarter and River area are about a 15 mins. walk, take comfortable shoes. I would only recommend this hotel for Mardi Gras, if you are traveling any other time I would look for a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and modern, but no water pressure!”
Reviews.Author: Sollibaba
Reviews.Content: Fun, clean, hip, and modern hotel that is located away from the craziness of the French Quarter, which is great if you want to get some sleep. The lobby somewhat reminded me of the W hotel or any other boutique hotel. Hotel was easy to find and the valet service was excellent. Granted, it was a quite weekend, but they always had our car available when we requested it. Check in was not a smooth as it should have been. The front desk lady seemed like she could have been trained a little bit more. She was unknowledgeable of how to put a hold on your card for incidentals, which usually occurs when you have already prepaid for the room (which I did). I think she realized her incompetence and put us into a handicap room which was very large, with a very large bathroom. It was located on a high floor with a great view of downtown New Orleans. Only complaint was that there was NO water pressure whatsoever. I felt like I was out in the light rain and could not rinse the soap off my body. Base on previous reviews, it does appear that water pressure and temperature seem to be a problem at this hotel. The Aveda amenities were a nice touch as well. Overall, I would stay here again. The pros outweighs the cons, but I do hope that they get their water pressure fixed ASAP so I won't have to be taking baths again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice place!”
Reviews.Author: spinkid
Reviews.Content: Great location, you can easily walk to Bourbon St. and French Quarter and also to downtown, you can also catch street cars to just about anywhere. The room was on the smaller side, but well kept, very nice accomodations. Staff was helpful when needed. The on site restaurant was never busy even though there were two very large events in town. We dined elsewhere at the many restaurants.. A CVS and a Walgreens are located very close by so you can pick up just about anything you need. Don't bother paying for in room internet, you can usually get a signal from the lobby or a neighboring hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay - great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lotsotripsneedsleep
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. We were treated exceptionally well, especially with the care of Monique Washington, one of the staff, who took extra steps to make our stay special. The staff were very friendly and responsive to our requests. The room was fantastic, very comfortable bed, beautiful fixtures, etc. I recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: vnv515
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed with this Renaissance hotel compared to other stays at other Renaissances. The lobby was nice but small. The staff was friendly. However, I was really disappointed when I was given an extremely small queen room. Granted, I did reserve a "small saver" room but I thought that I could get a better room due to my status as a platinum premier member on a relatively quiet June weekend. Not the case as I was given a room that could hold not much more than a queen bed. Additionally, I was unimpressed with the very small platinum gift. Other complaints: the hotel did not have decent foam/firm pillows and they did not refill the towels the next day; hotel is located in an alley way that I wouldn't feel safe walking alone.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Black2001GT
Reviews.Content: We received a great discount rate on this hotel through priceline. The Renaissance Pere Marquette is in a great location, 1 block away from Canal Street. The lobby is filled with relaxing, contemporary furniture and seating surfaces which were great for entertaining. The rooms were spacious for such an old building and clean. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate in all respects. My biggest pet...”
Reviews.Author: stevetanyaTexas
Reviews.Content: Adequate in all respects. My biggest pet peeve was the water pressure from the shower...too weak. Also not enough places to sit in executive lounge in the morning. Best service provided by Angelique at the front desk (outstanding service) and Jerica in the executive lounge (friendly-sincere service). Great beds... Very soft and comfy. Internet didn't work... Don't know why, but it should have.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel with great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: LNorton62
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just 1 block from French Quarter so is in quieter part of town but with easy access to it as well as the St Charles street car. Room and bathroom were large and comfortable. No mini bar but small fridge, coffee maker and safe deposit box in room. Tiny reception but helpful staff. Free internet in lobby. Restaurant in hotel, Mila is fantastic with innovative menu, good small wine list and great service.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique-like hotel on a quiet street”
Reviews.Author: fancy02116
Reviews.Content: Our tag line was going to be "a clean, comfortable room in a dirty city". This is more a Kimpton/Boutique hotel and a respite from Bourbon and Canal streets. We stayed 5 nights over Jazz Fest using points and the service was top notch despite the hotel booked to capacity. Room 1202 was a nice corner room with 2 walls of windows. Some tips: Free internet kiosks are located in the lobby next to the Starbucks, ATM's are local banks & charge high fees-shop at Walgreens/CVS located 1 block away and get cash back, visit the WWII Museum and see the Hurricane on The Bayou Imax movie. Enjoyed eating in the private group dining room at John Besh's Domenica.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Style Wedding”
Reviews.Author: danammf
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and clean and quite. Anything that we needed, extra blankets, towels or help with our room key, we got right away. The hotel is on the edge of the CBD and the French Quarter. It was only 2 blocks from the French Quarter to escape the craziness and noise but so close to walk and enjoy shopping and great food. The staff was so accommodating. We had a large party of people coming from all over for a destination wedding. Everyone at the Reception and Concierge Desk's were wonderfully helpful. One person in particular stood out, Anquelicia (probably not spelled correctly as I am trying to recall her name tag) was absolutely amazing.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: brevin
Reviews.Content: We decided to stop for one night with our boys during Spring Break in NO. Called Marriot and was able to book this hotel for $109 a night. Great deal. It was clean, rooms were nice, and the staff were nice. The consiere was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Renaissance Standards”
Reviews.Author: CapCityCapitals
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Renaissance Pere Marquette the past weekend. I was traveling for business at the convention center and she came along for fun. Overall I would say the hotel has a great location and is relatively nice. That being said, I don't think it measures up to the typical Renaissance standard. There were many small things that were broken. When I got to the 14th floor to find my room I walked down the hall searching for my room number. After not finding it and doubling back I asked a maid which room was mine and she informed me that it was one of the rooms missing room number plaques. I have attached a picture for reference. Inside everything seemed very clean, but the towel hook on the bathroom wall was broken and the drywall was slightly exposed. This is the second picture I have posted. Again, minor maintenance issues, but not the level of polish I have experienced at other Renaissance properties. The area immediately around the hotel was a little sketchy. It wasn't horrible, there were other pedestrians and I felt safe walking even at 10 pm, but I would not have felt comfortable walking alone, or with my girlfriend walking alone later at night. In fact, there was a shooting a block away the second night we were there. I'm giving this hotel a positive rating because of the good nightly rate I got here compared to other hotels in the vicinity. However my recommendation comes with reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location & Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Diam0ndBar
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed are stay. The hotel was close to everything. The rooms were very nice. Front desk staff courteous and friendly. Check in time was 3:00pm we got there at 4:00am. Thank you Renaissance Pere Marquette front desk staff for the early check in and a great room with a nice view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: chatnoir
Reviews.Content: Been here 3 days, so I suppose something could still go wrong, in which case, I'd write another review. So far, it's all good. Checked in around 10 pm on a Mon. night w/ no problems. Everyone super friendly & helpful. Besides service, the price & location were great. Won a room for a $55 a night bid on priceline, and when they add on their fee, it came to about $64.75 a night. Can't beat that! The hotel is 1 1/2 blocks from Canal St. & the street you walk on (Carondelet) turns into Bourbon on the other side of Canal, sweet! Looks a little sketchy but those 1 1/2 blocks seemed perfectly safe to me & we had no problems. Upon check in, they asked us if we wanted a room w/ 2 standard beds or a king bed. We took the king. I can't speak for all the rooms, just ours, obviously. The room (#1013) was a corner room that overlooked another hotel's pool/patio area on one side & some big stone cupola/ minaret type of structure on the other, w/ plenty of light. Not the biggest room in the world, but certainly not the smallest. Anyone who would think it was the smallest has not been to the Hudson Hotel in NYC & had a standard room there. We felt very comfortable in this one for 5 nights. There's a weight room w/ an outdoor pool. We used neither. Wifi connection costs money, so we used our own wireless notebook. The lounge looked modern & nice, not usually crowded. Don't know how much the drinks were. It's an old hotel. I wouldn't tout it as 4 stars, more like 3, possibly 3 1/2, but I was extremely pleased for the money. Also, our room was quiet. Relatively big bathroom, but shower did not have great pressure. Didn't use parking, but like so many places in a city, it was expensive, maybe $29 a night. There are a couple of $15 overnight lots about 3-5 blocks away. In room safe was free. There was a small fridge. The only thing about this hotel that bothered my husband (an ex pest control guy) was that the mattress & box spring have no plastic encasings on them, which is what many hotels have now to help control bedbugs. There were no bedbugs in our room. It's just that we prefer to see the encasings. All in all, I'd stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Does Marriott know about this dump calling itself a Renaissance????”
Reviews.Author: selectivity
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay here if you are familiar with Renaissance hotels. You will be dismayed to the point of disgust. Dirty, smells like a bad locker in the hallways. Rude staff that are completely belligerent and inattentive to its customers. NO 24 HOUR room service!! ONE check-in desk with ONE person. Hotel Night Manager that has no public relations skill whatsoever...in fact, he couldn't even offer an apology when I mentioned that this hotel does not even meet a basic Marriott level of quality or service. This place deserves to lose its right to use the franchise Renaissance name. I would give this place a 0 rating since the expectations are of a quality this places does not even come close to. The room is a cubicle with a closet for a 'bathroom' and the mattress squeaks like a Motel 8. Absolutely the worst experience ever. STAY AWAY. DO NOT STAY HERE. I chose the Renaissance for a level of service and you will be disappointed as I was. A wading tub is NOT a pool. AVOID THIS PLACE. YOU WILL THANK ME.

Reviews.Title: “Booked Mardi Gras VERY Late-- Pretty Good!”
Reviews.Author: Godenar
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to find any room, booking less than a week before Mardi Gras, to arrive the Saturday before Mardi Gras, but the PÃ¨re Marquette (in addition to J.W. Marriott) were available through AAA.com. Described as a boutique hotel, it had a hip, artistic lobby with bar and Starbucks, but it wasn't overly "boutique" in that snobby way I've seen in "boutique" hotels in other cities. We arrived by car just before the start of a Saturday night Mardi Gras parade, and streets were blocked, and the parking garage entrance was blocked-- we had to run out to the parking valet to get him to move the pylons. Mardi Gras stresses most every hotel and restaurant especially downtown, and some services were irregular to unavailable. For example, the parking valet came through for us by going to get the bellman's cart and acting as a bellman since no bellman was available. The room was nice, not tiny, as I expected from the word "boutique." The bathroom was huge compared to the room, with tasteful marble-tile floors, huge mirror, and shower (no bath) with a handheld shower head. Water was hot, but shower pressure minimal. Good, comfortable King bed, with a warm comforter. Small refrigerator in the room which wasn't working. The hotel is located in a good spot, 1 block off Canal Street, around the corner from the Roosevelt Hotel (and its famous Sazerac Bar and Domenica restaurant), and a good family-owned sushi bar, Yokohama, across the street. That said, downtown New Orleans, like other downtowns, is lively, and New Orleans likes its police sirens-- especially during Mardi Gras season. Note on Mardi Gras: If you have a car, you're not going anywhere during the parade or just before or after. Even getting across Canal Street into the French Quarter by foot may be impossible since parades come down St. Charles and turn onto Canal, and you can't cross the police barricades. On Mardi Gras morning we had to take a cab from the hotel, onto the interstate and around to the back end of the French Quarter to meet friends. The cabs are reasonably priced, though, so it's often worth taking a cab, especially if you don't know your way or if it's late. A highly rated restaurant, Mila, is in the PÃ¨re Marquette, but we were told it was closed over the weekend (not clear if this was every weekend, but very strange for Mardi Gras weekend). 1/2 block away at the corner is an all-night convenience store, Brother's, where you can buy fried chicken and fries all night. Brothers came in real handy when I needed liquids one day when I got sick (nothing to do with the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “!”
Reviews.Author: rachy_8377
Reviews.Content: i loved it... it was great! the hotel was very pretty inside and the rooms were nice also

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: andrewclauer
Reviews.Content: I travel to New Orleans regularly for work, and always try to stay at the Renaissance Pere Marquette. It offers a great location (on Common Street - just one block off Canal), and within 2 blocks of the beginning of Bourbon Street. You get the best of both worlds - good close-by location, without being the middle of the melee. The hotel is a great mix of old-school NOLA charm and modern conveniences. The rooms are well amenitized with everything you could want, large windows (though original historic, uninsulated) let in lots of light and upper floors offer great views of the city and surrounding neighborhood. There is a nice lobby bar and Starbucks consession that's open in the morning. There's a restaurant off the lobby which offers generally reasonable and unique choices. The staff/service is superb. Truly. I have stayed here at least two dozen times in the past 1 1/2 years, and have always enjoyed chatting with the staff, and on the rare occasion that there's an issue of some kind, it is always dealt with quickly, professionally and politely. The one and only complaint I have about the Pere Marquette is its room service menu selection. Don't get the wrong, the food is always good and the service great. However, as I'm often traveling for work for multiple nights (as I am on this trip - 7 nights), I get back from the day's meetings and need to work - and find it convenient to order room service. There are 3 "sandwich" choices, inclouding a burger, Texas toast grilled cheese (which is great) and a chicken salad croissant. There are two "rotisserie" chioces: duck and chicken. There are two "grill" choices: redfish and beel filet. And that, my friends, is the end of it. There are a few dessert choices and some apps - but 4 entree choices and 3 sandwiches. Really? Again, the very limited choices are always consistent and tasty (if a bit pricey). But, I've been staying here for years, and seriously, the room service menu does not change. I have asked the order-taker several times if there are "specials", and I am told that I may only order what's on the in-room menu. Really? Again, this is a great hotel - and ofen a "sleeper" when it comes to rates. There's a Marriott, a J.W. Marriott, a Ritz Carlton and a plethora of other upscale hotels in the immediate vicinity, and having stayed at all of the others, I prefer the Pere Marquette hands down. If you do some digging around on Marriott's website when booking, you can usually find a rate that's pretty close (if not cheaper) than the Courtyard that's around the corner too. I would recommend this place to anyone - and plan to submit a polite suggestion to management that they at least slightly enhance the room service menu. I doubt they'd like to know that they could lose a business traveler (me or others) over something so silly as updating a dinner room service menu selection. Enjoy this place - I always do!

Reviews.Title: “All-around excellence”
Reviews.Author: avmiddleton
Reviews.Content: Stellar service. Incredibly accommodating staff. Rooms are comfortable, modern, and clean. Amazing value for the money! The easiest way to see The Big Easy--- walking distance to the Quarter, but off the beaten path! We will visit again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Sleek Comfortable Great Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: Mal723
Reviews.Content: How can you beat my cost of $89/night? Top 10 restaurant MiLa is connected to hotel, had access to 19th floor Club Lounge-free breakfast that had essentially everything you'd need-coffee, fresh juices, eggs, cereals, muffins, jams, fresh fruit in a spacious and immaculate room with a super view especially in the morning and at night. Quiet location, friendly and attentive staff, clean, nice rooms, very comfortable, with character. Every floor is deicated to a jazz legend, mine was Dave Brubeck. Only downside was steep parking rate-$32.48 a night. But, with everything else, this was still a little over $130/night, so very affordable. They also have a great fitness center with everything you need, including free weights, fresh chilled towels, fresh fruit, workout benches,etc. If you want to be close to the French Quarter, yet in a quiter setting in the CBD a block and a half away from Canal Street, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “1 Block to French Quarter, St. Charles and Canal Street street cars.”
Reviews.Author: cassboett
Reviews.Content: I have to start out by saying this hotel is nice, staff very helpful, rooms clean, food at restaurant very good. It is conveniently located within walking distance to everything, and you can pick up both St. Charles street car and Canal St. street car lines within 1 block. The area is a little "iffy", but I was not alone and did not walk around alone at all. Breakfast, as is all food, is really expensive, but we found a little breakfast/lunch nook 1 block away, so we went there. The only thing I can really fault this hotel on is there is no drawer space in the rooms, literally. There were 2 of us for 6 nights, we were there for a destination wedding, so we had extra clothes and had to fold them up on the desk. There are 3 little drawers in the TV armoire and 2 little bedside drawers, but I think this hotel is suited to the single business traveler in NOLA for a convention, not for touring visitors. If you are changing clothes twice a day, as we were, you have no room to put your clothes. The rooms are really small, but that didn't bother me as much as nowhere to put your clothes! Other than that, it is nice, but there is a hotel 1 block away, the Roosevelt, that is beautiful and probably better suited to the visiting traveler, which, if I ever go back to NOLA, I would probably stay there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: Case1096
Reviews.Content: This Renaissance does not live up to the Marriott standards. My first impression was that of a long check in line with only one front desk clerk. Since 2PM is a prime check in time one would think that a single desk clerk would be insufficient. I had booked 2 rooms in either a two queen or king bed configuration. The room selection was not available due to the hotel being in an oversold position. The other nearby Marriott properties were also in oversold positions, so there was no chance at the reservations being fulfilled as booked. We were provided a queen room. Upon entering the room I found the smallest hotel room I have ever seen. A cruise ship inside cabin was larger than this room. To top it off it faced a brick wall and did not have a functional internet connection. I returned to the front desk and they had promised to switch to a king room on the second night of my stay. The next morning both of our rooms were switched to king rooms on a high floor with access to the club lounge. The new room was a standard king room as you would find in most hotels of this class. My problems did not end with the new room. The sheets were not large enough to actually fit the king bed and the pillowcases were stained. Housekeeping is clearly not doing their job. This was reconfirmed when I located a condom wrapper in clear view in the corner of the bed. Had housekeeping actually replaced the sheets from the prior guest they would have seen this. In addition to the poor housekeeping the hotel has several issues with their infrastructure. The walls are very thin often times hearing the TV in the next room. When the door closes to any room in the vicinity it can be felt several doors away. The hot water is hit or miss. One shower I could not get any hot water and the next morning the water temperature was too hot. If you do decide to brave this monstrosity then I highly advise to avoid any room ending in â€œ14â€� as these are insufficient to be called hotel rooms. The hotel will claim that these are queen rooms, but they are no larger than a closet in a standard home. They are even smaller than an inside cabin on a cruise ship!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: CincySaint
Reviews.Content: I used Marriott points to stay at the Pere Marquette because it was the same price as the N.O. Marriott. The location of the hotel is ideal. It's 1 and 1/2 blocks from Canal and Bourbon. So you have quick, easy access to the French Quarter but you are completely isolated from the noise and craziness. When you are done for the evening, it's a short walk home to a quiet hotel. I liked the hotel a lot. Very nice retro style with modern amenities. I had a corner room which was a good size. There was a king bed with cool ceiling lighting above it. The desk was large and there is high-speed internet access although I didn't use it. The only downside was the standard, old fashioned tube TV but who is in NOLA to watch TV? The bathroom was very large with a nice marble top vanity. I had plenty of hot water in the shower and at the sink. The provided Aveda shampoo and soaps were nice. The staff seemed nice but I had little interaction with them. The bar is very hip looking and there was a decent crowd in when I peaked in. I recommend this hotel for singles or couples traveling without kids if you want a cool place to stay that's quiet but still near the action.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water, no stars!”
Reviews.Author: dete444
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been remodeled but it is still a very old hotel at its core. There is no hot water at the shower or bathroom sink. Even a Super 8 motel has hot water! We will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel ... fast!”
Reviews.Author: Travel5856
Reviews.Content: Our room wasn't ready when we arrived, so we had a cocktail in the lounge, MiLa. I was told by the bartender he wasn't the best for a Bloody Mary, so he got someone else to make the drink for us. Though she was charming and friendly, it took the EXPERIENCED bartender 15 minutes to make two cocktails. The water during my shower went from a nice flow to no flow, then came back on bursting freezing cold water. This happened twice during the shower. My husband had no problem with the shower, but could not get hot water out of the sink faucet, so he shaved with cold water. We reported the problem on our way out. The shower was fixed when we returned, but not the sink faucet. We met another couple for breakfast, and three chose the buffet while one chose just coffee. We had to chase down someone to get the coffee after quite a long wait, then we were charged for four breakfast buffets. $18 is quite an expensive cup of coffee. It took so long to get the check fixed, we decided to leave and let the hostess know we would pay when we returned. She had just finished revising the breakfast check as we were ready to leave. It took approximately 25 minutes to get the check fixed. As we were leaving, we noticed our rental car in the garage, and I asked my husband to get our umbrella. The car was unlocked, unattended, and we could easily have had things stolen. In fact, keys were in the car so the whole car could have been stolen! When we returned to the hotel, our room had been serviced, but no fresh washcloths or coffee was left in the room. We left for dinner, told the front desk about cloths and coffee. Yes, it was replenished while we were gone. However, when I went into the bathroom looking for washcloths, I couldn't find any. My husband found them by the coffeepot. Strange? Maybe, unknown to me, most people actually bathe by the coffeepot instead of in the bathroom. We had a cocktail in the lobby bar before dinner, and wine choices were extremely minimal. In fact, the only red wine choice was nasty tasting at $9 a glass. I was told by the bartender something to the effect that they are short on funds for wine. Also, upon our return from dinner, I had to use the toilet, as soon as I sat down, it began making a bizarre, almost shrill noise, and I jumped up so fast I almost peed all over myself. We went outside for a cigarette, and two housekeepers were on the elevators with us complaining about their jobs, quitting, and being run ragged that evening by the guests. My thought was if they had left washcloths and properly serviced rooms the first time, they wouldn't have been being run ragged. VERY unprofessional of them to complain about their jobs in the presence of guests. Just as we got to sleep there was a very loud static in the room. It lasted about ten seconds when a voice finally interrupted saying the fire alarm is a false alarm. I had been in the hotel business for 20 years, and I have never heard loud static as an alarm. Finally, I am requesting a review of my charges as I currently have an additional $252.14 on my hotel bill that I am disputing. I know I've left a few things out of my not so pleasant stay there, but I would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Clean, Up to date great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CollegeTraveler00
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely a great value for the price! We paid about $62.00 a night in mid August. The hotel was very clean and very modern. The hotel room was a little smaller than normal but that is the French Quarter area, the rooms tend to be French. But absolutely very good quality. Also, if you are a Platinum Elite member, the concierge floor is great! Brennan (our host) was extremely helpful and knowledgeable about the area since he grew up there. The only thing that wasn't up to par was the customer service sometimes. But as I have experienced customer service is just a matter of chance, whether you are getting people at the right time or if certain people are working so I do not think it clearly reflects the hotel. Most of the time people were very courteous and helpful. The only time we had a problem was when our toilet was clogged and we asked a couple of times for maintenance but never received it. Valet is an extra $29 a night but anywhere around that area is going to be that expensive, so budget that if you have a car. It is about a 2 min walk to Bourbon street! Perfect location to walk to the hot spots but far enough where you are not getting the noise... perfect location! Also, if you are on a budget the hotel breakfast room service is way expensive! $9 for a bowl of oatmeal? Yikes! But right across the street is an ihop :) Also there is a starbucks and bar in the main lobby that is helpful. And if you don't have a computer, no problem! In the lobby they have a couple of free computers and every time I wanted to use it there was always one available!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: jr75austin
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in an awesome location. The location is just a block from Bourbon St and I was a little worried, because I read a review that said the area around the hotel was sketchy, but the streets were well lit and we had no issues. The only bad thing I can say is that when we arrived late at night for check-in they could not find a bell cart for us, but other than that the staff and room was great. We would definitely stay again. I do have to add one note people were complaining about parking prices and yes they seem high, but they are in line with the the rest of the hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “OMG OMG OMG Beautiful Hotel AWESOME staff”
Reviews.Author: Luv2hittharoad
Reviews.Content: The Staff at the Renaissance Pere Marquette is fabulous. The Front Desk staff is the most friendly EVER!. They take pride in their hotel and take great care of the guests. I had dinner in the restaurant and it was fabulous! They brought me a sample app. Drinks were great for the price. Breakfast in the restaurant was just....I have to tell you it was awesome. Try the Crawfish Omelet and the Pecan Banana Pancakes. It is a 5 star restaurant, so if you are looking for a $5 breakfast don't go there. The average cost for breakfast was $40 for two people but it was well worth it. Again, the restaurant staff was excellent. The decor in the lobby area is just too fab. There are lots of little nooks and crannies to sit in and have great conversation. Private little rooms with beaded curtains are comfy and very well appointed. Whatever training they are doing at this hotel is certainly paying off. It is only a 10 minute walk from Harrahs casino and even less to Bourbon street. It is a great location if you want to be in the action but not "in" the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Great Parking HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Nieceyd
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in notice $29 a day parking. Our trip was 3-days. Hotel wonderful. Rooms a little small but your in NO how much time would you spend in the room!! Staff friendly and helpful. PARKING is where my trouble begin. During departure we waited 30min for our car and was told the car was parked in a parking garage or lot 3 blocks away. When we recieved our car the rum we purchased was missing. We paid $29 a day for secure/safe place for our car for it to be broken into by STAFF. Even with eyewittness to the theft an investigation has to take place. We live in Texas so our investigation will take place on a phone. Mgr of the parking garage was hiding from us living it up to the parking attendants to handle the dirty work. Once we spotted him he was comfronted and had to come talk to us. Long story short we left NO without the Rum we purchase (that is not available in Texas) and with a 800# & reference # with hopes of getting or money back. According to one of the valet this is very common, so that's make it more sick to may stomach. Hotel was no help becasuse according to them they partner with the parking garage owners to provide a service they do not handle their issues. ( - : So learn from my mistakes never leave anything in the car if you want to keep it, no matter where or how much you pay for parking. NEVER ASSUME, you know what will happen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: bikeridergirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights for an excellent rate. Since I booked on Expedia, they offered a club room for $3 extra per night, which made all the difference. We were initially placed in a 3rd floor room with a queen bed, which was tiny. Once we explained we had a club room, we recieved a room on the 17th floor which was definatley larger. It was basic but very clean, large washroom with shower only. I wished that had a small table with chairs though. The bonus of the club room was the club lounge. There was breakfast there, (continental but with eggs) which was excellent. Then in the evening, they put out 'appetizers' which included sandwiches and a hot dish (jambalaya one night, cat fish another). The staff there and in the restaurant were extremely polite, friendly and acommodating. As per the other reviews, the lobby has a great trendy look, and there is a starbucks but they close at 1. They had 2 computers for free browsing, the only downfall is there isn't a time limit, so you may have to wait a while. Found the location fantastic as it was very quiet, but 2 blocks to Burbon street, one block to the street car and Wallgreens. The pool is very tiny, more like a wading pool and only good to refresh not swim. The gym was tiny, but clean and well equipt.

Reviews.Title: “What a great little find!”
Reviews.Author: jccarcamo
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Pere Marquette was quite a surprise. Quaint but spacious rooms, Excellent service worthy of a few stars going above and beyond. The only drawback was that there was no quick-serve coffee/snack shop open at convenient hours.

Reviews.Title: “Impossible to take a cold shower”
Reviews.Author: pinotnoirhokie
Reviews.Content: I had an opportunity to stay at the RPMH last week for a conference. The location of the hotel was very convenient to the French Quarter and restaurants/shops on Canal Street. The images on the website weighed heavy in my decision to select this hotel. The lobby was immaculate. Not very crowded at all and everything looked sharp. There was plenty of comfortable lounge space available at all points during my stay. Unfortunately, I was a queen room on the 7th floor on the first night of my stay. To say the room was small would be a gross misunderstatement. I barely had enough room to unpack my suitcase. The bathroom was unremarkable and every time I wanted to take a cool shower (a must given the heat index was 105 degrees), the shower would shut off. The fantastic staff at the hotel remedied my small room situation and moved me to a king size room on the 19th floor. The king size room had adequate space. The bathroom was much larger than my other room, but was not much more well appointed. For a Renaissance property I was greatly disappointed by the following: cheap quality of the towels in the bathroom, the pillows were hard as bricks, lack of free internet/wi-fi in the club lounge. Unfortunately, the excellent customer service I epxerienced from all of the staff with whom I interacted could not make up for the shortcomings. Please note, the exercise room was well equipped as I enjoyed a couple of Federation Cup soccer matches while running on the treadmill. The pool, sadly, is only 3.5" at its deepest. If you plan on doing anything more than wading in the water during a summer stay in NOLA, then I'd suggest you call around and find a property with a larger hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel just outside of the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: missmacy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Pere Marquette for 3 nights in May. We had a mix of older and younger travelers (4 women) and the hotel met all of our expectations. The rooms are spacious, clean, and the beds are extremely comfortable! The rooms/bathroom are something that you would not expect for such a low price, they were fantastic! The lobby is beautiful as well. My only complaint is the location, the area surrounding the hotel is slightly dicey. Returning from the Quarter late at night worried me a little. Otherwise it is very close to the Quarter (although it is across Canal St.) and close to the St. Charles streetcar. The excellent rate that I received made it a worthwhile choice. The computers downstairs were very convenient and I was able to confirm my flight in seconds. I would stay here again with a group, but probably not by myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great decor”
Reviews.Author: localhomeandgifts
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this caliber of hotel for the price. Easy walking to all the action, great check-in/check-out experience. We didn't experience any problems with service at any time. Very clean. Great, modern decor, beautiful bar and lobby area. Comfortable bed. Only complaint was the set-up of the room. The way the bathroom door opened up across from the closet door and behind the room door made for some diffuclut navigating. Agree with last reviewer that the water in the lobby was a great touch, and that the pool area was quite small and only allowed for a few guests at a time.

Reviews.Title: “An ok hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Brad B
Reviews.Content: I just completed a five-night stay at this hotel and I'd say it has a great location and is perfectly acceptable, but whether or not you stay here should be based upon the room rate offered. I had a rate of under $75/night making it well worth it. Location - This is really an ideal location for a couple of reasons. It's a safe location, and you're only a couple minute walk from Bourbon St., just off Canal. And you're also only a couple minute walk to the St. Charles streetcar stop.
