And being just outside the French Quarter makes for a quiet hotel but a couple minutes away from a lot of noise (if you want that). Getting a cab is also very easy here. The hotel lobby itself is quite striking - a bit modern, sharp, nice bar scene, and there's also a Starbucks and a couple of computers for internet use. The rest of the hotel is pretty nice looking too - I liked the little jazz touches (pictures) throughout the hotel, and the potpourri next to the elevators on each floor. Most of the decor (flooring, furniture, furnishings) appears to be on the newer side and this helps make the hotel physically attractive. The ice water with oranges/grapefruit in the lobby most hours of the day was a nice touch, especially when coming in from the heat. All of the staff I encountered were very friendly. That being said, there were a couple of service glitches. First, there is usually only one person at the front desk at a time (although I did notice two on a couple of occasions). Thus, if you need something at the front desk, you could end up waiting 10 minutes or more. This happened to me when the key to my room stopped working and I needed to have them rescan the key. Also, they didn't make up my room one day. I called when I got back to the room late in the afternoon and I said "no problem" about the room not being made up but I asked for fresh towels. When I had still not received the towels a few hours later, I had to call again. Oh well. But when they did make up the room, they did it well. I suspect that the service issues are probably the result of hotel being understaffed. But one thing that was very efficient were the elevators. You will never wait long for an elevator. My room - overall good enough size and again, the furniture and carpeting were in very good shape. I wondered about my bed mattress though as it sloped badly near the edges. Also, one of the windows had a pretty big crack. There is high speed internet in the rooms (12.95 I believe, although it's free for Marriott Silver and above) and a decent sized desk should you need to work. The internet connection was pretty fast, although not wireless. There was also a good size safe in the room. The room itself seemed pretty quiet and the hotel was sold out a couple of nights. Either I had very quiet neighbors throughout my floor or the walls are pretty thick. I was on a club floor (17) but the club lounge on the 19th floor was closed every time it should have been open. So if you are Marriott Silver or above, don't stay here expecting to have continental breakfast or drinks in the club lounge. The bathroom was slightly small, but had decent counter space. I liked the Lather brand soaps/shampoos. My room featured a stand alone shower only and it was a little tight. Water pressure was definitely an issue . . . pretty light . . . but worse was water temperature. Often, the sink did not have hot water, and it varied throughout the day without reason. The shower temperature frequently changed too, but I was never without hot water in the shower (although at the same time I wouldn't have even warm water in the sink). The pool area is pretty poor. It's on the 3rd floor outdoor deck and features a handful of chaise loungers with torn fabric, a very tiny pool about the size of a very large hot tub, and mostly shade throughout the day. If a pool is important to your stay, don't stay here. The fitness room had a few treadmills and a couple of ellipticals - at least one of each type featured non-working controls and the machines are pretty dated. There's also an exercise bike and some dumbbells. But all of the machines have television screens and there are free earphones in small packages as you enter.

Reviews.Title: “2 night break pre cruise”
Reviews.Author: OdieUK
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel at just after 9am after a very early morning flight from Houston. The reception were helpful and immediately allocated a 5th floor room overlooking the street. The porter/bellhops were very helpful with the extended amount of luggage - as well as giving advice and information, especially regarding safety and security during the festival. The room allocated was spacious and clean, with what appeared to be a recently refitted bathroom. However, closet space was minimal compared to other hotels. Windows were not double glazed, so some street noise could be heard - especially at night with drunken and party revellers, but ultimately this was minor. Location wise the hotel was ideal - just a few minutes walk from Bourbon street and the main tourist area. The Charles st streetcar line was closeby. Plenty of restaurants from local cuisine to fast food were all within minutes. 24 hr drug stores/pharmacy 2 minutes away. We did not use the hotel restaurant or bar - so cannot comment on the service and quality. There is a Starbucks coffeeshop on the ground floor. We did use the room service - which was only 'average' and a little overpriced. They did phone back twice to confirm the order that had been placed, as they seemed unsure. Inroom tea/coffee maker was provided, but with very limited supplies each day. Despite requests for more this did not happen. The pool area is pleasant, but on the small side. Check-out was hassle free despite the reception area being extremely busy. Luggage is stored if required. Overall a decent hotel at a reasonable price for a 2 night stay pre cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Style”
Reviews.Author: intlfoodtrvl
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Pere Marquette is an ideal choice for New Orleans accommodations. The hotel is located in the Central Business District, only one and a half blocks from the French Quarter. The spot provides a quiet environment away from the hustle and bustle of Bourbon Street, but also gives the convenience of many restaurants, shops, bars, etc. all within walking distance. The St. Charles streetcar is also only a two block walk and will take you straight through the center of the city, making frequent stops from one end to the other. While this Renaissance has a snooty French name, it has been renovated with trendy decor. The guests skew younger, providing the hip lounge with an active bar scene. The stylish lobby also contains free internet access, several seating areas, a Starbucks (unfortunately only open in the morning), and complimentary fruit-enhanced water. The front desk service is very helpful, though somewhat inept. My friend and I had a reserved a portion of our stay through Hotels.com, and the remainder through the hotel directly, as it provided additional availability. Upon check-in, the front desk attendant had confirmed that he would blend the bookings so that we would not have to change rooms or be otherwise inconvenienced. However, our digital room keys stopped working on the day our first reservation expired. We had to revisit the lobby to amend the situation, which was aggravating. We also had an issue with the concierge. I had called down one evening to inquire about local food delivery options. The concierge kindly offered to drop off some menus. We were initially very impressed by this, especially since it would be providing competition for their in-room dining. Well, of the four menus we received, two did not even deliver to our area; one was too hectic because of Jazzfest and not available to come to our hotel; and the last was Domino's, which we refused to order in NO. In the end, we wound up with the hotel room service, but we loved the food! Our mixed greens salads were topped with edible, fresh flowers; sunflower seeds; and a light lemon vinaigrette. Our cheese platter included a bold bleu, stiff Parmesan, and creamy brie. These delectable dairy selections were served with homemade raisin bread toast, fig and berry compote, and apple jam. We were able to make tasty little sandwiches from the fantastic selection. We also received glasses of ice water, slices of cornbread, and amazing cheese biscuits with our tray. Needless to say, we were very satisfied with the meal and quick service. We also took advantage of the fitness center, which offered three treadmills, two Precor machines, and some free weights. Each machine was equipped with its own television. Additional amenities included fresh fruit, cold hand towels, full bathroom with shower facilities, complimentary headphones, a water cooler, and a vending machine for Gatorade. The attached pool was on the roof of the third floor, providing a calm oasis, but little sun as the area was fenced in by larger neighboring buildings. We were satisfied with our clean room as well. The bed space was a bit more cramped than most and was missing an additional seating area. However, we were provided with a large television, desk, and vast selection of coffees and teas. The bathroom was spacious and modern. The shower was refreshing, but could have benefited from stronger water pressure. On a whole, we were content with the accommodations. I would definitely stay at the Renaissance Pere Marquette Hotel again, due to its location, fun atmosphere, and extreme cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm, undecided”
Reviews.Author: GuyinSF
Reviews.Content: Check in was challenging. After three attempts, I was able to get into a room. The front desk staff were great with the exception of the night security person. Someone was having a party in the room next door a little past midnight. I called the desk to ask if they could ask them to be quiet. I called three different times during a duration of 45 minutes. I finally went down to report it and she called the security person who FINALLY went up to ask the occupants in the room to be quiet. I think it is a good location and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Quiet Stay, Good Rate”
Reviews.Author: DoubleD1969
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Pere Marquette Hotel from April 14-18, paying $100/night ($20 food/beverage credit included) for the first 3 nights and using points for the last night. I've stayed at a Renaissance before in Chicago, so I was expecting a little bit more. The Pere Marquette lobby was much smaller than the one in Chciago, but overall, it had the same feel. The hotel was just across Canal Street from the French Quarter and was a block or two from the St. Charles street car. We were on a 9th floor corner room. Although we didn't have the greatest of view, the room was pretty large. Their concierge floor was consistent with other Renaissances. I'd stay here again for the same deal.

Reviews.Title: “Plesantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: iTunes22
Reviews.Content: This is a great stay! Granted, I did not have to worry about the cost considering that my company was paying for it. However, I would definitely return to the hotel and stay on a leisure trip. The staff was very acccomodating and the rooms were spacious and big. The only "nit" that I had was that it took the bellhop quite a long time to bring up the internet ether cable so that I could work on my laptop. The food at the hotel was also excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: GoingEverywhere
Reviews.Content: We loved most things about this hotel, which is in the 1920s Pere Marquette building in the CBD. It's a historic building, but the design has that sleek, hip feel that Renaissance seems to be striving for. We liked being in these surroundings, and we liked the people who work here. ROOMS: They were a bit small, but perfectly nice and featuring local art. The beds are great, and so is the shower. You'll get all the usual in-room amenities. The only odd thing to report was the in-room coffee. You can make two cups, one regular and one decaf. We would have each liked a cup of coffee with caffeine -- didn't really understand why they couldn't leave enough for both of us to get what we wanted. SERVICE: Everyone on the staff was universally friendly, from the check-in to Starbucks to the valet. The service itself was hit or miss. On the negative side, we asked for a bottle opener that never arrived. On the positive side, we spoke to a bartender who took the time to determine our tastes and then recommend new drinks that we might otherwise never have thought of. On the negative, our bags never quite made it downstairs upon checkout (our request apparently never made it to the bellhop; should have found him myself). On the positive, we were given $15 in free Starbucks coupons (treated like cash) just for being Marriott Rewards Silver Elite. And the staff at MiLA Restaurant was also fantastic. OOOOOH THAT SMELL: Other reviewers have commented on the scent of the lobby. I didn't notice the smell more than once, and only when my girlfriend commented on it. But she noticed it whenever we were near the hotel's main entrance -- nice scent, but overpowering to her. Not a big deal, unless you're sensitive to it and spending a lot of time at the registration desk. RESTAURANT (MiLA) -- I'm going to write a separate review on this fine restaurant. I am always split between wanting to see more of the city and spending at least some time in the hotel that I've paid to be at. In this case, I read the reviews about MiLA and decided this would be a great place to eat a nice dinner. We were not disappointed. Our table tried several things on the menu, including dessert. Each of us had our favorites, but we all agreed that MiLA was one of our better meals in awhile. VALUE: We actually used points to pay for the room, but the actual cost would've been $119 a night. I've seen it available for $99/night, as well. For a hotel of this caliber, that's a bargain. NOISE: I didn't hear any noise from the other rooms, nor did we hear any noise from the street. But drunk hotel guests coming back to their rooms at 3, 4 and 5 in the morning were no treat. Is it that hard to keep your voices down in the hall? I think sober people know that, because returning guests got louder as the night wore on. We can only hope that maid service returned the favor and woke up these loud guests early! :-) INTERNET: You can print your boarding passes in the lobby if you're flying out. That's convenient. In-room access is free if you're a Marriott Rewards member with Elite status. I think it's $12.95 otherwise. PARKING: Standard valet parking is $28/day, a common price in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value right near the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: traveler646
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 2 friends for a long weekend. Got a great rate through AAA. first impressions- the front of the hotel doesn't look as nice as it does in the picture, and it has an entrance to the parking garage right next door. However, inside is a much nicer spot- the bar/lounge is right off the lobby and has ample seating. There is a Starbucks located right inside, and I heard there are computers there. There is also a computer right near the concierge where you can print out boarding passes free of charge. Little things like that, as well as complimentary water with lemon, are nice touches. Check in was fast, and as requested, they had our room ready 5 hours before check-in time. Our room did not disappoint overall, but there was definitely an odor of smoke and there was a plastic bag (looked like a garbage can liner) over the smoke detector. We notified the front desk and they said they'd put an air filter in the room. I'm not sure whether they did, as the room continued to smell, as did the hallway, even though it was a non-smoking floor. The pool was nice, but small, and may not have had enough seating on a busier weekend. The gym was also nice. The staff was friendly and accommodating the entire weekend. The hotel was a quick walk to the French Quarter, but far away enough where it was quiet at night. It's also located right off the street car, which is nice for trips to the Garden District. If you're looking for a nice hotel near the action for a decent price, this is a good spot for you.

Reviews.Title: “not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: explorepossibilities
Reviews.Content: Third and last stop on our Music City Marti Gras Tour!! Our stay was 3 nights. We are Marriott members and are always upgraded, but once again, they had us booked on the preferred level in a KING room instead of two beds! This was the third time on the same trip. Because of that, we were put on a very low floor. Again, not a huge issue, but we have the cards and book with certain hotels to get the upgrades. The front desk did give me 4 Starbucks coupons because of this though. These rooms were the smallest of the trip, but they were nice. The beds were nice, the lighting was good and there was an in-room safe. The hotel location for Marti Gras (Bourbon Street/French Quarter) was awesome, walking distance but not right on top of it. The lobby was very nice and the staff was always helpful. Renaissance hotels are always amazing, this one wasnâ€™t quite as cool as others I have stayed at, but above average. The pool area was very relaxing. We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: blondemommy05
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 year old son and I stayed here the first weekend of Mardi Gras, which also happened to be Valentines Day Weekend. As a former local, I wasn't put off by the location of the entrance or the fact that we'd be 1 block from the parade route. The first weekend is pretty tame in comparison with the second weekend. My son loved being able to walk from the hotel to the parades. And that was especially convenient for the evening parades. I have to agree with other travelers about the scent. As soon as I exited my taxi from the airport, I could smell the fragrance that's being pumped into the lobby and into the street. As first blush it was attractive, but then it became cloying and annoying. Check in was easy, but I was unimpressed by the lobby. It is nice that they have a computer dedicated to flight check in and a printer solely for the purpose of printing boarding passes. And I loved that they had free internet access on desktops right near the in-hotel Starbucks. Unfortunately for me it was also very close to the bar....LOL! The room was tight and the space was not used in the most efficient manner. But it was clean. And the bed was comfy enough, although the last 2 days of our 4 day trip my back was hurting. The pros - the most and best lighting options of any hotel I've ever stayed in. An amazingly huge bathroom. The air vents were anywhere near a place where they blow directly on the bed - for me a plus, for my husband a minus. The negs - not so thrilled with yet another hotel that does not have shelves for towels (ick!). They had two hooks near the shower and a hook on the back of the bathroom door. There was no tub, which isn't a problem for me and my husband, but my pre-school son was not at all happy about having to use the shower - admittedly it was Euro style and on a hose, but he still cried the entire time we bathed him. Also, I don't know whether it was the location of our room's windows or if it was the vents in the room, but we got the strongest scent of meat on the grill during dinner hours. It was particularly strong on the Friday night. When we walked out of the hotel I looked up at our windows and saw that they were in line (albeit 15 floors higher) with the vents from the restaurant. It was annoying, but the smell was gone by about 10pm - around when the kitchen shut down. I'm a Marriott member and so, we were put on a high executive floor meaning we had access to the executive lounge. This came in handy in the AM for free quick coffee and a bite to eat, but they are closed on the weekends in the morning. In the evening they had hors d'eourves and free soda and water. And best of all Zapps potato chips. Which they ran out of by day 2 and never replenished during our trip. Otherwise, I found the staff to be pretty helpful and accomodating. They also allowed us an extra hour for check out. I had to cajole them, but they eventually gave in the morning of check out. I also got two bills and they assured me that I'd only be charged once, that one had an error on it so they printed a second one that was left under my door. Come to think of it, I need to go check my statement to make sure I was only charged once.... All in all, I think you get what you pay for with this hotel. I got a great rate way in advance - $159/night during Mardi Gras/Valentines when I booked in November. That was not a rate I was going to get just a month in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: trippingmeout
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the RPM for 4 nights. I was originally at the Marriott on Canal but wasn't too pleased there. I walked over the RPM, asked to be shown their rooms, and they gladly switched me over to their property that moment with no problem (since they're both technically Marriott). I loved this hotel. Decor and staff were great. I like the crisp, clean lines and modernly elegant boutique atmosphere. The lobby lounge was beautiful. The room was clean, spacious, nice and relaxing. The in-room safe was very useful and bathroom amenities were great. One con to my experience though was that they did not give me the wake up calls I requested (on BOTH days I needed it). So set your alarm clock or cell phone alarm just to be safe. However, they were very apologetic and tried to make up for it any way they could. Things happen. This was the only negative point. Otherwise, staying at this hotel made my NOLA expererience all the better. To sum up: great staff and facilities. It's in a great location (make a left @ lobby, quick left on the next street. This street actually turns into Bourbon St. once you cross Canal st.) I never even needed a car or taxi. I walked easily to the French Quarters, Harrah's Casino, and French Market. If you don't want to walk to the French Market, the street car trollies are just a block or 2 away. I'm a single girl traveler and had no problems walking back to the hotel at night. It is pretty well lit and safe (of course, always be aware of your surrounding). I would 100% stay here again. If you prefer a more modern/updated hotel that is in a great location, this is the hotel to stay at. It was perfect for me.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service. Don't waste your time”
Reviews.Author: kcerialo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I made a reservation for Valentine's Day one month in advance. When we got to the hotel the front desk agent told us that we were being "walked" to another hotel because the hotel was oversold. When I asked to speak to a manager, the manager told us that there was nothing she could do and that the hotel had overbooked rooms that night and we would have to stay at another hotel because they didn't have any rooms available. So, despite the fact that we had pre-paid the hotel and made two phone calls to confirm the reservation prior to check in, we were left without a room on Valentine's Day. Instead of trying to accommodate us, the staff rudely turned us away and ruined our trip to New Orleans. Don't bother staying here, there are plenty of nicer hotels with better customer service in New Orleans. It may seem nice from the outside but the customer service is awful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to the French Quarter...”
Reviews.Author: remjay8186
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel though priceline and got an excellent rate of $55/night. The room and bathroom were spacious, the beds were comfortable, had a great view, and the staff were very nice. The hotel is two blocks away from the French Quarter and about a 10-15 minute walk to Harrah's, for those of you who want to do some gambling. The hotel has a bar as well as a Starbucks and there's many great restaurants within walking distance. The only negative is that they don't have wifi. Overall, a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ILnative
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Jan 8-10, 2009. Had a King bedroom - very good view - overlooking the river and french quarter with lots of windows. The room was pretty large (enough room for a couch and a chair as well as the bed, desk, etc.) and the bathroom was decent sized as well. Normal Renaissance amenities. As I have Gold status we got access to the concierge lounge which was nice for breakfast on Friday - however it is closed on Sat/Sun mornings. Front desk personnel were very helpful. Elevators were quick to arrive. Bourbon street is literally 2 blocks away. The only negative thing was the smell in the front lobby and elevators - they are obviously spraying something - which in moderation might be nice - but several times we got on the elevators and it actually burned our throats and we aren't necessarily sensitive to those things. If you do have smell sensitivities - this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Brian90212
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family from December 26 to December 30, 2008. Hotel was nicely decorated with a relaxing odor in the lobby area. Renaissance is located 2 blocks from the French Quarter. Lobby area has a bar that opens nightly at 8 p.m, two large containers with lemonade and cherry/raspberry juice (free to dispense), two computer workstations that are connected to the internet and to a printer (free use), and a computer to print out boarding passes. Parking is $28 a day (Valet) which is high but expected for a hotel establishment close to the French Quarter. My family's room (17th floor, room # 1704) was a bit small for four people. Despite Renaissance claiming that the room was 350 square feet (32.51 square meters), it felt smaller than that. Bathroom was quite big with the shower featuring a swinging door rather than the standard shower curtains that you see in most hotels/motels. Internet is not free in the room and is $12.95 a day, but it also includes free unlimited local phone calls and long distance calls within the U.S. Bed was good enough for my family's expectations. I will point out that while our stay was good overall, it was not without some minor issues. For example, on our 2nd night stay, housekeeping did not clean the room when my family was gone the entire day. It was only after we called the front desk and left for dinner that the job was done. Housekeeping also forgot to replace some of our dirty towels on the 2nd and 3rd night and required me to call the front desk to get them delivered Pleasant stay overall. If I came back to New Orleans, I would consider staying at this hotel again though I would consider the other three Marriott hotels located near this one (JW Marriott, Courtyard, and New Orleans Marriott).

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Pere Marquette”
Reviews.Author: whamicin
Reviews.Content: Went to New Orleans for our 20th wedding anniversary and stayed at the Renaissance Pere Marquette. Excellent hotel with a great staff. Very convenient, only 1 block to the French Quarter as well as the trolley lines to Uptown and the Garden District. Easy walking to the riverfront, casino, etc. Room was well layed out with a very comfortable bed. Would definitely stay here again. If you like martini's, get with Chris in the bar for his signature "Gin Deaux"......outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Close enough to the French Quarter without the craziness”
Reviews.Author: dtravelgirl007
Reviews.Content: One of my friends & I went for to New Orleans for a class reunion at a hotel near Bourbon St. But since I love Renaissance Hotels & found out this was 2 blocks away, this was my hotel! The hotel website said the facade of the hotel was under renovation. No problem! I don't look at the outside. Also there was no noise. It was a short walk (turn Right out the front door, Right on Dauphine St., pass Canal St. ) to the French Quarter. You would hit Bourbon St. if you turn Left out the front door. We wouldn't recommend that. There's a better view on Dauphine - a great Catholic church with exquisite architecture. As they say, stay with a group in NoLA. There are some possible worrisome locations but in general there's a lot of people walking around this neighborhood. The room (1808) was nice - with 2 double beds - was nice & roomy. As always, the bathroom was large and LOVE the Lather brand toiletries. Each of the floors was 'named' after a jazz artist. Our favorite was the 15th floor - named after NoLA's own Harry Connick Jr. That was fun. Since I'm a Marriott Gold member, we got to hit the club room on the 19th floor. The host each time was very friendly and pleasant. Our biggest gripe was the front office staff. They were - at times - not as warm as you would expect for a Renaissance. Almost like they didn't want to help you or we were bothering them. Overall, we enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: sloDublin
Reviews.Content: My daughter booked thru HOTEL.COM. . Had a breakfast included in the price of the room. . When we got to the hotel desk: They stated: : Only 2 from each room could eat breakfast. We had2 rooms with7 people:4 adults and 3 small children. Breakfast would have cost $16.00 per person. The rooms are small and the bathroom has no place to put things away. The staff tries very hard to be nice. The maids throw things away and do not always replace them. We had to ask for more towels and bathcloths . Parking is $28.00 a day.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT service!!”
Reviews.Author: 2Busy2
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best hotel stay, ever. I travel a lot and know the good, bad and the ugly. I've never had hotel staff to be so attentive and work to make everything perfect. We stayed during what was probably the busiest week for New Orleans but you wouldn't know it by how well we were treated. Everything was at our doorstep with Bourbon St. one block away, Harrah's, shopping and fine dining within walking distance. MiLa's restaurant is delicious and it has the best staff, ever!!

Reviews.Title: “First trip to New Orleans and loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mm2cute
Reviews.Content: As soon as we pulled up to the hotel we were impressed. Everyone at this hotel was very helpful and polite. They would go out of their way to make sure we were comfortable and had everything we needed for our stay. At one point we needed towels so we called and got them in less than 5 minutes followed by a call to make sure we received them. Room service was great came quickly and was awesome! It was so close to the french quarter and everything else you would want to do in New Orleans but still far enough that you could not hear absolutely any noise the hotel was actually really quiet all day everyday. We drove from Houston so we did the hotel valet and never had to use our car at all because we were able to walk everywhere we needed to go. Valet was pricey at 28 a day but that's average for every hotel in the area included in and out privilages 24/7. Loved it and plan to return!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for this not so luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: grandmommyof4
Reviews.Content: Paid close to $300 for this over-rated Marriot property. Asked the front desk for a quiet room AWAY from noise, i.e. elevators, ice machines, vending, etc. Room given was 2 doors down from the ice, etc. Bed pillows smelled like an unwashed old man. Luxury towels included 2, only TWO, worn-out ,frayed, tiny bath towels. One expects more when requesting a concierge room--which wasn't initially given, and had to be asked for, even though the room rate indicated the upgraded room. This room was very noisy--the hotel room doors slammed constantly and the traffic continued all night with the horns beeping, loud stereos, etc. Yes, this is New Orleans, but some people like to sleep a few hours a night. Coffee machine could not be readily accessed to pour water into it unless you had the small hands of a 5 year old. A very poor design. The only respite from the air of decay permeating New Orleans was the lobby of this hotel. How does a city expect more tourists if this is the price and condition of the so-called "luxury" hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Not to be missed!”
Reviews.Author: delovelyest
Reviews.Content: This property is gorgeous! Newly renovated and with a lot of old world charm. Our room - a standard double - was spacious with lovely large windows and cathedral ceilings. The bathroom was huge and spotless. Just a joy to stay in all around. Loved the lobby decor and music also. Coffee bar in the lobby is conveniently situated and staffed with very helpful folks. That goes for the whole place, actually. Had nothing but good experiences with all of the employees there. Hotel restaurant is serviceable, but with so much great food nearby, don't waste your time. Excellently situated to the French Quarter - right off Carondelet, which becomes Bourbon Street if you walk one block across Canal - but far enough away to be quiet and private. I can't recommend this place highly enough!! I had a wonderful stay here and I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to all the action, very nice place.”
Reviews.Author: elkameno59
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with all you need to make your stay great. Staying here was a great choice. It is a very short safe walk to Bourbon St. and to shopping on Canal St. Take a short walk to the Casino or River Walk too. Not to far from great restraunts and sightseeing. We stayed for 4 nights and 5 days it was very comfortable. Rooms are nice and clean and the bathrooms are large. Updated and cleaned up since the storm. Lots of construction going on around the hotel on 2 sides so I would visit the room they want you to have and look out the window to see if it will be a problem. Hotel is accross from a few diners and quick mart type deli's open 24 hours. You can be on Bourbon Street in 5 min, just walk out of the hotel turn left at the corner and cross Canal Street and your there!. Staff really care about your needs. Elevators are slow so get a room on a lower floor and use the stairs. Pool looks like a nice quiet place for a drink or reading a good book outside. No place really to sit anywhere outside except the pool area. Gym is nothing special but the towels are ready and clean with a vending maching in the club to buy a bottle of water.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice newly renovated property”
Reviews.Author: RWC99
Reviews.Content: Very nice, newly renovated property 1 block from the French Quarter (think quite for sleeping, but not too far to the party spots!). Location is great. The rooms are nicely appointed, and have nice, large windows for plenty of natural light. Front desk staff and restaurant staff (for breakfast) are very friendly. If your rate includes breakfast, do take advantage of it (otherwise, buffet breakfast is USD$15, as of March â€™08). Starbucks coffee bar on site (but closes early â€“ 2pm, as of Mar â€™08). Try to ask for room XX17 (the largest on the floor). Nice Lather brand toiletries, but housekeeping may or may not re-stock you. As mentioned by a previous post, the staff is generally not quick with delivery requests â€“ we had to call twice, and it took 4 hours to get a bar of soap. If quick service is important to youâ€¦be forewarned! Overall, a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: D_Toronto_2008
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms were spacious and comfortable, the service at this hotel was very disappointing, so I would definitely not stay here again. The reception stuff was often unwilling to pick up the phone and it would require at least several tries to reach anyone there. The information obtained from stuff and managers regarding breakfast and amenities was conflicting and often inaccurate. The buffet breakfast did not change for my entire week's stay there, and at the rate of $15US per person did not even offer simple things such as grapefruit juice. The wait stuff needed to be asked repeatedly in order to bring simple things such as salt and butter. The service at this hotel was definitely the worst service I have ever received from any hotel I have stayed. On the plus side, hotel location was good - close to French Quarter, bed was very comfortable and rooms were made up on time and plenty of towels and toiletries were provided on daily basis.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, just outside the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Dreaming_spires
Reviews.Content: After reading a number of the reviews, I have to say I was a bit worried about staying here on my own. I was, however, pleasantly surprised. I booked the hotel through the organisers of the conference I was attending at a rate of $95 per night. I had requested a double w/ two double beds since I was expecting a friend to join me. In the end she couldn't make it so I asked if the room could be changed to a king on arrival. The front desk was very obliging and made the change instantly despite being very full. They also had a package I had sent prior to arrive to the hotel brought to my room right away. The room (717) was a good size and clean. I think it was designed for disabled access. It had a closet, desk, good size bathroom with shower/bath. The room was surpisingly quiet even though it was next to the vending area for ice and vending machines. I ordered room service the first night I was there. The hotel is still not running the full room service menu but did provide a shortened version for use. I ordered from this and 5 minutes later someone from the hotel knocked on the door and told me that the menu had changed slightly and asked me to choose something else. Whilst not ideal, the food followed soon after and was really very good. Breakfast was not included in my rate, but there is a Starbuck's in the lobby that does coffee and fruit/yogurt which is ideal for breakfast on the run. My room was made up by the time I returned everyday around lunchtime. The hotel was excellently placed for eating and drinking, just one block from Bourbon Street and the French Quarter. The hotel does have a restaurant as well and a small bar in the lobby. It also has a pool (outdoor) and a gym, but I didn't use either of these. Overall, I thought the staff were friendly and helped as much as they could. Speaking to other people at the conference, I think this hotel probably fared better than some of the others in New Orleans. I think it is a good choice for business or pleasure given its location and the facilities offered. My only gripe was the information provided by the hotel. They displayed the folder showing the standard information about all Renaissance hotels and their services, even when it is clear that they are not yet offering all that they used to pre-Katrina. It would be useful if they just displayed information specific to Pere Marquette as this would cause a lot less confusion and frustration on the part of guests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happy-Yappy
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have stayed in New Orleans many times in different hotels and this one was very nice. It's been renovated since the storm and still has construction going on in the lobby but had a very nice and clean room and I am very particular about staying in hotels. The staff was excellent! The staff we encountered were very helpful and friendly including the valet area. We would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price via Priceline! Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: bmccollum
Reviews.Content: Myself and a college buddy stayed here this past weekend (Oct. 27th-28th) to attend a football game between The University of Memphis Tigers and the Tulane Green Wave (the Tigers won, by the way!). Thoroughly enjoyed the hotel and had no problems with anything. Stayed in room 703, which doesn't have a view of much aside from an empty office building across the street, but no big deal there. It's about a block from Canal St. and is in very easy walking distance from the hotel to all of the sights/sounds/etc. of Bourbon Street and the remainder of the French Quarter. Hotel was very quiet at evening and it was a rarity to hear an automobile going down the street or people making any sort of commotion, which was nice for sleeping purposes! And mind you, this was the weekend before Halloween... Rooms were a little on the small size, but again, not a big deal there. Bathrooms were VERY spacious and this was a nice surprise. Parking was $28 per night, which seemed a bit high, but I have to remind myself that this is New Orleans and hotel parking in that area of town typically does come at a premium. Bed was one of the most comfortable beds I'd remembered sleeping on at a hotel in recent years. Did not partake of the hotel's breakfast (not a free continental breakfast, mind you) in the a.m., but it looked very good as we passed by the offerings. Hotel as a whole appeared very well maintained and very clean both in the public areas and in all areas of our room. Hotel regularly runs for $200+ per night if you book a room through one of the "normal" means of doing so, but I bid $80 via Priceline back in early September and got it for $80 (+ tax) per night, so the whole thing was $128.69 for the room, tax, and overnight parking... for a very nice 4-star hotel very near all of the "action" that New Orleans has to offer. Not bad... Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: marbus2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights and it was a mistake. When we arrived in the room (quite small), we discovered only 4 hangers in the closet and no bathrobes. After calling the front desk to receive these items, we went to dinner and returned 3 hours later. Still no extra hangers or bathrobes. After a trip to the front desk, 3 extra hangers were delivered, along with the bathrobes. There was no bathtub, just a shower and we weren't aware of that. The sheets were not changed during our stay, the bed was simply made. No mattress pad was used, so the fitted sheet was right on top of the mattress. On our second day, we returned to the hotel around noon and the room had not been made. We left and returned again at about 3:30 and still no service. When we left at 4, we mentioned it to a member of the housekeeping staff who was in the hallway. Upon our return at 7:00, the room still had not been cleaned. On our way out to dinner, we stopped at the front desk. She seemed suprised that we still wanted the room cleaned at that hour. Lobby is undergoing renovations and is not very attractive. The side street upon which the hotel is located is very dark and I was very surprised that there was not a bellman/front door man on duty at all times. The staff was rather surly. I would not stay here again and I'm not sure I'd ever stay in a Renaissance, because this was such a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “fairly good time at the renn. PM”
Reviews.Author: NavTrav
Reviews.Content: stayed at the PM on 9/17. hotel is still renovating the lobby, which is due to be finished by october. the hotel entrance is located on a quiet street without much foot traffic, and i was surprised that there were no employees at the front door, or on the ground level, as the lobby is temporarily on 3. checkin was ok. my initial room had weird pipe noises coming from the bathroom, so i called down and spoke to a manager. she moved me to a room on the club level, which was fine. the rooms are all virtually new. sort of a minimalistic style. beds are nice. bathrooms are also nice. hotel was very clean. their gym was great! multiple treadmills and ellipticals. all new. also, they each had their own lcd tv. didn't have many interactions with staff, but the ones i did, were fine. they did try and charge me for parking, when i hadn't used their garage. location is pretty good. 2 blocks from the beginnings of bourbon st.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve1969
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 6th floor at the Renaissance Pere Marquette for several nights beginning on August 6, 2007. The hotel is very clean, despite a little construction in the lobby area. Bring a wireless router if you want wireless Internet; otherwise, you'll need to bring an Ethernet cable. Internet is available for ~$13 per 24-hour period. My original room was 614, which is the "smallest room in the hotel", according to the front desk. After a few minutes in the room, the front desk promptly moved me to another room. There was literally two-to-three feet of space on each side of the queen-sized bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaymart91
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was ok, nothing special. Room was a little odd shaped. Bed was comfortable. I believe lobby was about to be renovated, so it was non descipt. Staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: MayfieldCats
Reviews.Content: We are staying here right now. Been here two nites. I just book my last two nights with hotel down the street (Marriott). The room is very nice but we had a number of problems from the start: Telephone didn't work, tv remote didn't work, two light bulbs were out, the safe didn't work and a hook in the bathroom is ready to fall out. I had to request these repairs TWICE before they were fixed. (The hook is still not fixed.) The final straw was this morning, our wakeup call never happened. Luckily I am a light sleeper and our room is situated next to the elevator so I haven't slept well anyway. I also had to ask them to turn the music down by the elevator, the saxaphone music came right into my room. Maid service did not come until 5 p.m. last night!! Hope your stay here is better than ours.......

Reviews.Title: “Average - clean rooms, good location, awful food”
Reviews.Author: skimeld
Reviews.Content: A nice clean Renaissance, nothing special. But the restaurant is closed - as with many New orleans businesses post-Katrina. Room service food was awful. I'd stay here over the French Quarter any time however, as it's a short walk and you dont get all the noise of the revellers of (horrible) Bourbon Street etc.

Reviews.Title: “Really good value”
Reviews.Author: Deedumans
Reviews.Content: We paid $99 per night for our room for 3 people. The decor was very cool, the rooms very clean, and the staff very nice. They even let us do our laundry for free. Very Comfortable beds! The location was a quick two minute walk to Bourbon Street...yes, you have to walk over Canal and it can be a bit sketchy, but all in all felt pretty safe. They have very limited services...eg room service in limited hours, but were happy to put us in touch with a pizza place that delivered until 4am. All in all very good value and a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrman66
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great; one block off of Bourban street, however, all the buildings surrounding this hotel are boarded up and at night this can get a little creepy. Inside the hotel the lobby is small but nice. The rooms are of decent size, clean with a simple, modern decor, and the bathrooms are quite big. There isn't much of a bar, and the restaurant has a limited menu. I'd pass on the breakfast given the cost/what you get ratio. The internet connection was fast, but pricey. What I did like the most, was the comfortable bed. If you are a business traveler who likes to stay in the hotel at night this is not the place for you (only because there isn't much of a bar/restaurant). However, given the location, room size... this hotel is a decent choice for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel--clean but loud and in a so-so location”
Reviews.Author: Boston_girl6
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok--but nothing special. I stayed 6 nights for a big conference that was in town. I got the impression that the hotel was nice a few years ago but suffered a bit with Katrina. The staff was very friendly and polite. The room was nice--clean and fairly big. It was pretty loud though--seems like the walls are a bit thin. Plus the cleaning people were extremely loud--talking very, very loudly in the hall starting at 8:00am daily. Other guests were loud, too--there was yelling at the pool, plus banging and other very loud noises from the floor above and room next door. This isn't the hotel's fault per se, but it did make my stay less pleasant. Two other minor problems: the business center lost a package sent to me they had signed for, and one day my room wasn't cleaned and the staff showed up around 7 pm to clean. The location of the hotel is ok--a bit shady, though, due to the number of vacant and boarded up buildings nearby. The proximity to the French Quarter was great, though--a very easy walk. I was hesitant to walk alone after dark in the area, though. The section of Canal St. the hotel is near is pretty sketchy.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: haji
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel while on a business trip. The location of the hotel reletive to the French Quarter is great. It is one block off of Canal St. away from the Quarter. Unfortunately, the area that it is located is still showing evidence of Katrina. There are a lot of empty buildings and remodeling still going on. There isn't much of anything around in the way of shops and restaurants unless you wander a bit from the hotel. The hotel itself is somewhat difficult to find. It is on a small offstreet and surrounded by one-way streets and is not easily seen from street level. The lobby has been nicely redone although the dining area seems to be almost empty at night. The floors are named for Jazz greats, but other than the name there doesn't seem to be anything special about them. The rooms are nicely furnished but nothing out of the ordinary other than the microwave and small fridge in the rooms. My room was clean, however the room assigned to my colleague had not been completely cleaned upon check-in. The front desk assigned him another room with no problems. In addition, there is no concierge lounge for Rewards members and they did not offer any alternatives to account for this. All-in-all I would say that if you want to stay at a Renaissance property, then do so at the Renaissance Arts. It is slightly farther from the Quarter but the area and the hotel itself are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Zach-Anne
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Renaissance on Dec 30th, 2006 after an 8 day cruise to the Caribbean. It was good to be back on land, and we looked forward eagerly to visiting New Orleans. When we got to the Renaissance, we were delighted. The location was great, very close to the French Quarter and only one block from Bourbon Street. The hotel was luxurious and clean and had contemporary jazz style dÃ©cor; and the staff was very courteous and helpful. Our cruise ship had docked in the morning, so we arrived early, expecting that we would not be able to check in. We figured that we would leave our suitcases at the hotel, grab some coffee and explore a bit. However, the reception staff managed to find us a great room and helped us to check in right away! We want to mention some wonderful people who helped us â€“ Marco, Danny and a few others. Marco in particular was very helpful. He found our terrific suite for us, gave us great tips during our stay, recommended first-rate restaurants, and told us the best things to do with our time there. The hotel itself has a great little cafÃ© and again, wonderful people who waited on us (donâ€™t remember names). Inspite of renovations going on after Hurricane Katrina, the hotel atmosphere was one of sophisticated elegance and comfort. Our room was excellent (# 901) â€“ a spacious corner suite with nice big windows on both walls with great views of the city!! After having been on sea for several days, we loved the wonderfully comfortable bed and the big luxurious bathroom. The bed linen was soft cotton, and the down comforter and pillows were a treat. The bathroom was as big as a medium sized room with a marble floor and a nice vanity; the herbal bath products were great and smelled really nice. The workstation was a large desk which had plenty of room to fit our laptop and other stuff. On the whole, we loved our stay at the Renaissance Pere Marquette and will definitely stay there again on our next trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Valet Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: prtlady
Reviews.Content: The stay at the hotel was average. However the parking for each night was $28.00 per night. The parking clearly stated that the $28.00 fee was for 24 hours. After the Bayou Classic (football game) my family was approached by the manager of valet for an additional $8.00. The manager of valet stated that the 24 hour parking fee was not valid after 4:30 pm regardless of the time of check in - clearly contradicting what the sign posted said. What is ironic about the situation is that the valet manager stated that they were not affiliated with the hotel and still wanted to view our billing statement. Because I don't believe in public scrimmages we paid the $8.00 but did not receive a receipt. This needs serious attention. I would hate to think that this was part of a scheme- to con people out of money, but there is some doubt as to the validity of this situation.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: macnalex26
Reviews.Content: The suites in this hotel are absolutely stunning, with great city views and jacuzzi tubs. The hotel was quiet and private. I definitely recommend this hotel to adult travelers who look for luxury, comfort and privacy in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice - great service”
Reviews.Author: lisatravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel back in June for a conference and have been meaning to post this review for several months now. I was absolutely amazed at the excellent service provided by this hotel. Not only was the service here amongst some of the best service I have ever received at a hotel anywhere, but I was really expecting limited service after reading about post-Katrina NO. I had excellent service from everyone from the desk clerks to the concierges to the wait staff and the doormen. My room and bathroom were spotless. The room was nice, though nothing particularly special. I did really appreciate the fact that there was a lot of natural light in the room as there were 2 huge windows and the bed was very comfortable. The room also had a fridge and microwave, which I liked. In terms of furniture the room only had a desk, desk chair, dresser/entertainment center and the beds. The bathroom was VERY nice. It was marble and had salon type toiletries. When I was there the restaurant hadn't reopened yet and there was a limited selection of dinner entries served in the lobby, so I can't evaluate dinner. The last day I decided to have lunch at the hotel as I didn't have time to go elsewhere. They had a fixe price 3 course lunch for $20 and it was great, particularly the mussels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cokerbud
Reviews.Content: If everyone would have worked as hard as the folks at Renaissance Pere Maquette Hotel to get New Orleans back in shape, the job would be done. This hotel is beautiful in every way, and the rooms, although small, were clean and quiet with a wonderful bed. The staff makes you feel at home and have to be the friendliest folks on the planet. The hotel is close to the French Quarter and is easy to find. You will not go wrong staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service @ Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fcc11
Reviews.Content: Must agree with the last few reviews. The staff more than makes up for the few inconveniences as the hotel tries to get back to its former state. Room spacious and airy with large bathroom with glass enclosed shower. Incredibly soft and comfy beds . Wonderfully fragrant herbal soaps and shampoos are provided. Small fridge and microwave are a great convenience. Pool is small but provides a cool,quiet environment to unwind. Restaurant plans to reopen in August. Quick and easy check in upstairs with concierge service at lobby entrance. Staff was friendly and professional-going all out to make your stay a great experience. Spread the news that New Orleans is ready and willing to show you a good time ... and the Renaissnace Pere Marquette will be a wonderful host for your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: Angelina41
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and quiet, and the ambience was a perfect retreat from the hot New Orleans sun. Big fluffy beds and nice showers made the visit even more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel with a very friendly and welcoming staff. I completely agree with what the traveler from Baton Rouge said in the June 23rd review.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlk0413
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Pere Marquette is a wonderful small hotel. The staff was so friendly and very helpful. The room was extrememly confortable and the bath was large. Marriott's have a new bed system that makes the beds the best in the business. I slept very well. They have a workout room, laundry facilities and a small pool - all of which met my needs. While, as in most of New Orleans, there are some issues. The hotel restaurant has been moved to the lobby on the first floor. They are renovating the original. The menu is somewhat limited but the food was wonderful and well presented. Streets around this hotel are under construction and that made it somewhat diffucult to drive. There is still much to do in all of New Orleans to get things back to pre-katrina levels. What ever this hotel lacked, it made up for with excellent staff and small touches that made you feel welcome. They bend over backwards to see if they can accomodate you. One nice touch - in the evening, they put candles on each step of the stairway to the second floor. Very nice and indicative of their wilingness to make your stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrishFan
Reviews.Content: Loved the rooms, very nice and helpful staff. Still doing some fix up work after Katrina, so no bar or restaurant. But that's not too much of an issue in New Orleans, as the property is only a couple of blocks from the French Quarter. Somewhat "iffy" neighborhood between the hotel and the Quarter, but it's such a short distance and on busy roads so I didn't feel threatened or anything, came and went at all hours by myself with no problems. They were working full speed ahead on the restaurant area in mid-March so hopefull it will be back to normal soon. Room was a bit on the small side, but comfortable, nice bed, nice bathroom, plenty of closet space.

Reviews.Title: “Only a short walk to the quarter”
Reviews.Author: alyson003
Reviews.Content: Hotel is still going through some construction. It took me awhile to find out where to check in. When I arrived there wasn't anyone on the first floor and finally figured out the front desk was on the second floor. So that was odd. I really like the furnishings in the room. They seemd recently updated. The bathroom was a good size and so was the room, but I think it was bigger beacuse it was a corner room. Internet access costs $10 a day so that was irritating when so many hotels offer it for free now. I felt safe here. It's only two blocks from Bourbon and I never felt threatened walking around. But you should NEVER walk by yourself anywhere in New Olreans. Once the St. Charles streetcar gets running again you're only a block from it. I would recommend this hotel if you can get it for less than $130 a night. They still have some service issues, but I expect this is going to be a problem in New Olreans for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our first visit to New Orleans (July 2005) and could not have asked for more wonderful accomodations. The staff was superb and made every wish a reality. We had a fantastic corner king size room with a full bath (with bath tub) and luxurious accomodations. We easily walked to the french quarter daily, returned late at night, and felt safe at all times (which is suprising for me- I tend to be paranoid at times). We definitely plan to stay here on our future trips to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Not feeling the love ...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: TRAVELERS BEWARE. My husband and I had a pre-Katrina reservation that we were seriously considering canceling due to the disruption of life in New Orleans. However, we decided to stick by the city's side for our anniversary trip in early December. About the time we decided not to cancel, we got a call from the Marriott Corporation. They let us know our reservations were confirmed but that the hotel's restaurant, lobby, and bar would be closed for renovations; the rep was effusive in his thanks for our not canceling our trip. We felt very good about being loyal to New Orleans--and Marriott. HOWEVER, when we arrived at the Renaissance Pere Marquette, we were told our reservation was no longer valid at the pre-Katrina rate. "It will be substantially higher," said the female desk attendant, who was very gruff and curt with us. She claimed our reservation was a "corporate" one--not one through them directly (???). When we asked to see the manager, someone (not the manager) came down and was sarcastic in stating that he could not honor our previous reservations--we would have to pay much more to stay there. They also told us no other rooms were available in the city. (!) We're not sure what's going on but we're contacting the city's hotline on price-gouging to find out how they can investigate them not honoring corporate reservations. HAPPILY, we paid more for a room with EXQUISITE service at the Hotel Monteleone, where employees are constantly thanking us for our help in rebuilding the city's economy. And our anniversary trip has been saved!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at the Pere Marquette”
Reviews.Author: sandy_riblet
Reviews.Content: We spent the first night of our honeymoon at the Pere Marquette and really did not want to leave. We were too tired to go out on the town, but shortly after we checked in, our 'personal server' Tamika called up to say she had something special for us... she arrived with a beautiful bottle of champagne and a tray of fruit, brie, and crackers. The service was so friendly and attentive, we really felt special. The bed was very luxurious and comfortable. We were also upgraded to a room on the top floor. The lobby and the room were both very nice, modern and stylish. The room wasn't huge, but it did not feel cramped in any way. The bathroom was also very nice - the lack of a bathtub (just a shower stall) was not a problem as we never use hotel tubs anyway. All of this was of course sweetened by the priceline price we paid - but when we saw what the full price was, we would gladly have paid that or more!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: rbtpat
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels an average of 120 night per year and most hotel experiences run together unless they are terrible or in this case exceptional. As a platinum Marriott member, I decided to stay here because it was close to the french quarter and I like the perks. Little did I know that this was the Ebony Magazine music festival. This town was packed with people and the staff at the Pere Marquette handled it without so much as a frown. The staff was so helpful and friendly, you felt like they couldn't do enough. The wonderful women in the conciege lounge were the most personable that I've met anywhere. The rooms were very comfortable as I would expect in a Renaissance, but it was the people that made it memorable. Kudo's to management and staff!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Treatment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located (you can walk most anywhere). On check in we were offered apples. The staff were great. My sister and I took our 68 year old mother to New Orleans. The bellman serenaded us after unloading our luggage and showing us around the room. He stayed (and smiled) while my mother played twenty questions. He sang "You are the Sunshine of my life" when got us settled in but I'm sure he was singing "Amazing Grace" on his way down. We were given suggestions on which tours to take and where to eat. The rooms were clean and classy. The service was super. The parking was pricey. It was $25.00 per night to park your car in the hotel parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, hotel, great people!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Pere Marquette during June 2005. We paid $85/night via priceline.com. This is a great hotel. Everyone was extremely friendly, helpful during check-in, etc. Anytime you passed a maid, bellboy, etc anywhere in the hotel, it was always, "HI, how are you? How's your stay so far? etc" The staff was excellent. Overall, the hotel is very nice, done up in a modern style. The lobby is super air-conditioned, you'll appreciate this in muggy NOLA. The lobby is big, plush chairs. The overall hotel was kept CLEAN, including the lobby, the hallways, the rooms, etc. The rooms themselves are smallish, with one table and a Herman Miller chair, one king-sized bed (in our case), and a small bench at the edge of the bed. The bathrooms are spacious, but only have a shower, and no bath-tub, jacuzzi, etc. There is a safe in the room that is large enough to accomodate a laptop --- which is very nice, and got its use while we were there. There's a closet with plenty of hangers, and free robes for your use(we didn't use them) Overall the rooms are modern, up to date, very clean, etc. The maid always had the room cleaned from the time we left, 'til the time got back. We often slept in, and so we might leave at 11am, and be back within a couple hours. A lot of hotels don't pay attention to your schedule, or bang on the door at 9am or 10am. The cleaning staff was very attentive. The room size is quite acceptable at the price we paid. I would have been upset had I paid more than $200/night and got this room. I still think this hotel would be a bargain at twice the price, however. The in-room adjustable air-conditioner worked great, which is sometimes shaky in hotels in warm areas. There is in-room high speed internet access ($10 extra per night), but we didn't need it. My laptop picked up a free dhcp-providing wireless internet access from somewhere --- not sure if it was the hotel's or a neighboring business in the tall office building next door. The pool, btw, is small and only 3.6ft deep. There are perhaps only 8 chairs around the pool, but we had no problem getting in and out of the pool. The free health club/gym that was there had enough equipment including treadmills, weights, etc. The location is just outside of the French Quarter, one block west of Canal St, and one block North of Bourbon street. Definitely far enough from the noise/commotion, and not a bad walk to the French Quarter. Crossing Canal can sort of be a pain in the butt, but there are 'walk' lights for pedestrians. The St. Charles streetcar stops right at the edge of the hotel's street (Common Street), and provides easy access to various parts of New Orleans including Garden District, Riverfront, etc etc. The location is good. I saw some negative reviews of the hotel listed here, and I wonder if they even stayed at the same hotel as we did. We won this hotel via Priceline, and wondered what we had got ourselves into. When we arrived, everything was perfect. I couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. And couldn't have asked for anything more at the price-point we paid.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: goingonvaca
Reviews.Content: Over Memorial Day weekend, I had the pleasure of staying at the Pere Marquette. The rooms were plenty big, it was mod and chic, everything was very clean; and the staff was so friendly! Location was great - a couple blocks from Bourbon St. We ate breakfast in the hotel twice and it was just fine - standard fare. The rooftop pool was small, but room enough for a good number of people to sit around and enjoy a little oasis in the city. As far as value goes, we booked through hotels.com for about $120/ night. I thought it was pretty reasonable considering I spent the weekend in Manhattan recently and paid triple that for the same type of boutique like hotel with a much smaller room. I would recomend the Pere Marquette to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms ..but pricey”
Reviews.Author: nachi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel during the french quarter festival. The hotel is just two blocks away from the french quarter and is super close to the st.charles street car line. we stayed in the 9th floor and got a corner room. It was very quiet. The lobby is really really nice.. The rooms are kinda small though. Even though the check in time was mentioned as 3.00pm , when we checked in at 1.00pm the room was ready and they let us in which was really nice. The bathroom did not have toilet tissues and when we called in they came and placed one immediately. We also had problems with the flush , but it was fixed immediately. The bathrooms do not not have an exhaust and kinda stinks immediately after some one has used it. The bath room shower did not have enough force and the bath tub was super small size. The swimming pool in the hotel is super small (kiddie size). Overall i would say for the prize we paid we expected a little bit more than what was there.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: halls12590
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the French Quarter Festival, and had many problems. First, the wall next to our bed had the elevator shaft on the other side. All night long you could hear the noise of the elevator (including the bells) as it went from floor to floor - very annoying. Even more annoying, however, was the lack of water pressure in the bathroom. It took me at least 45 minutes to shower every morning (I have long hair) and my boyfriend had to sit on the floor of the tub to get himself wet. Add to this that we were woken up one morning at 8:00am by construction being done on a room adjacent to ours... When we complained they appologized, but nothing was done to fix these problems. The maid service was wonderful, as was the location - but you would expect much more from a hotel this expensive. In short, if you have hair to wash and expect to sleep and be relaxed on your vacation DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CJKatl
Reviews.Content: My room was awesome! The bathroom was very spacious, the staff sweet as could be. Great location - close to Bourbon Street action, away from Bourbon Street noise.

HotelInfo.Name: Renaissance New Orleans Pere Marquette Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 817 Common Street, New Orleans, LA 70112
